description: The calzone are okay, they're literally an entire pizza folder in half. It's a lot of bread and cheese with minimal toppings, but tasty. I'd spit one with a group but wouldn't recommend as a meal. It'd be like eating only garlic cheese bread. :)
author: Noel L.

description:
Had to try 4 ATMs around 3 blocks as the owners didn't wanted to accept my card. Finally came back as they were OK to get my card (it was a $40+ tab).
Waited for our large pizza and wings and got the wrong pizza prepared (we wanted the San Francisco), served with a "oh sorry, we can offer you napkins".
We took the wrong pizza not to wait longer. It was doing the job but the wings were not.
the ranch sauce ($ add-ons) was random.
That's it
author: Youpi R.

description: Friendly service and decent pizza. It's not my favorite but it's tasty nonetheless. My boyfriend ordered a Hawaiian slice (please don't argue with me about pineapples on pizza) and it was pretty good!! Crust was a bit thicker than I would like and not too crispy but the great part about this pizza was that amazing cheese pull. Prices are competitive, I think think our slice was around $4 and the size is relatively large. As usual, condiments such as pepper flakes and parm on the side.
author: Janice L.

description: The pizza was good not great. For a pepperoni it didn't have much pepperoni but the crust was good and it had plenty of cheese. My biggest complaint is that it was delivered to our motel with no napkins, no plates, and only two packets each of cheese and crushed peppers to split between four people. Stingy.
author: Becky L.

description: The price keeps changing every week depending on who takes my order. I have been a faithful customer since 1995 and before I even went meatless their Calzone with pesto, feta, mushrooms, black olives and extra cheese is my go to. I brag on this place!!! Fix you prices please.
author: Lydia V.

description: About 4 times a year theres a street brawl in front of this pizza parlor, but tonight the brawl was between what appeared to be staff members and a group of ppl dbl parked in the street. As i was watching, a guy suddenly came charging out of the pizza parlor with a giant machete! Thank God his friends were quick on thier feet and grabbed him. After a minute of wrestling with him, they shoved him back into the pizza parlour and the car sped away...This could have been a horrible crime scene... so I say thanks but no thanks for your shitti Pizza
author: Steve B.

description: Get me to the Greek!!! I love this place. The Greek is the shit. The Tijuana would be next and then the San Francisco. I used to go here about three times a week when I worked up the block. Not once was I unhappy with what I had. The slices are perfectly sized. One slice if you  still wanna get shit done and two when you want to feel like your pants are gonna bust. And the best part is that this pizza is the cheapest in the area. Bout half the price of village and you don't have to deal with the owners evil bitch wife. And the guys at Napoli are super chill. Perfect fit for Polk street.
author: Jacob N.

description:
Good pizza, while other places have them already made, this place makes them when ordered. Plus extra toppings is like 
50 cents. Best pizza place in the area.
author: Michael S.

description: Best place for pizza delivery. Ordered pizza, lasagna and chicken wings and the food was delicious and arrived hot. Price is very reasonable for the high quality of food. Pizza is way better than big name pizzas and chicken wings was the best if you love buffalo flavor. I would eat again and recommend this restaurant. Thank you for the timely delivery and good service.
author: Saleh A.

description: A great place for a slice in a relatively sketchy section of Polk. They treat you nicely and the slices are nicely sized. One was plenty for a meal for me. The menu is limited but hey it's solid.
author: Noah K.

description: Eating here drunk and late night - pizza is most likely awful but cardboard tastes good at this point and it wasn't expensive cardboard
author: Mike H.

description:
On my walk down polk came in here as part of my pizza by the slice hunt. $2.50 for a plain cheese. $3.50 for hawaiian and the most expensive at $4.

Two friendly efficient guys go to work and after a few minutes your pizza is ready. A thin crispy crust with a couple bubbles is really great especially considering it isnt freshly baked. 

3 tables, 6 chairs in here. A counter to eat at standing when it gets packed late night.  A couple regulars come in and one big group helping turnover.

You dont have to be hammered to enjoy this pizza its great.
author: Stefan T.

description: I discovered this gem about 20 years ago.  Small store front that seats about 6 among the 3 tables.  But most just get slices and leave.  I got mine to go.  I ordered the 12" San Francisco (pepperoni, beef, bacon, olive & feta cheese).  The crust is thin and buttery.  Just as good as I remember it.  Thanks for not changing...
author: Sam H.

description: If you hungry and it's late, this is one of the few spots to grab a slice in the city. As a place that stays open late, it's not much of a looker. There's some counter space and a few tables to eat. The pizza they sell is meh. Not good but not terrible. It's on pair with I'd say 7-11 pizza, one of those things you won't get a craving for/go out of your way for but when options are limited and you state of mind impaired/drunk it will do. The guys working the counter were friendly and FYI it is cash only.
author: Peter P.

description: Tried this place for the first time. I got the Greek w/chicken added on. It was only $4.50/slice. They bake it fresh upon order & have it out within a few mins. Fresh ingredients and I love their crust. Only downside is parking can be hard to find, but it's expected in t
author: Jenae K.

description:
Orderd 2 large pizzas with delivery. After first bite we noticed it was burned, the bottom was black on one of the pizzas. The other one was very good. 
I called the pizzeria to notice them about the bad pizza and the response was:
-Since you've eaten on the pizza we won't replace it. 

Well, how many look at the bottom of their pizzas before eating? And we didn't even finish a slice. Poor service and barely worth a star.
author: Philip E.

description: Their cheese bread consists of hot dog buns with cheese....and their lasagna lacks cheese in between layers. However, the staff was extremely friendly.
author: Alyssa K.

description:
Can't really go wrong with $4 for a slice of pizza when you got the drunchies going on. Both the Combo and San Francisco were not bad - they definitely don't skimp on the toppings. They were even nice enough to add extra olives for no extra charge when we asked. :)

The area this restaurant is located in is a little (okay, pretty) sketch, so I would not want to venture out here alone.. especially if I'm intoxicated. Definitely use the buddy system here at night!
author: Christine S.

description: We are going strictly on the quality of the basic pie here. Everybody like their pizza the way they like it...I used to go to this dump on West 14th St. in NY to get a slice...I'd pass 10 places to get their slice. This place, Napoli...it's very good pizza. Real cheese, I like this crust, just enough crunch...just a little. The place looks perfect but I wouldn't go there on a first date...or any date.
author: Rodney M.

description:
Looking for a slice at midnight in the city, this is your place. It's close to my hotel and had a higher rating than the place across the street.

Most are $4 for several toppings, cheese is 2.5 and pepperoni is 3. They run it through their oven so it's nice and crispy on the bottom. Crust is great too. Nice and doughy.

If I lived or drank in this area, I'd get to this joint.
author: Erin P.

description: I really tried to like this place but it was terrible, I forgot what the pizza was named but it had mushrooms and some kind of sausage? There was no flavor, the meat had no taste, and the mushrooms didn't seem fresh they tasted straight from a can. I paid $18 for not even a medium sized looking pizza and I was very disappointed. Only reason I gave two stars is because they had my order made right away.
author: Jasmin G.

description:
Came here for late night pizza with a friend after a night out on Polk Street in Mayes. I'm actually kind of surprised that not a lot of places were open after 11PM...c'mon, isn't the city supposed to be alive with the smells of drunchies?

Napoli's delivers delicious and ENORMOUS pizza for an affordable price, but that's all good if you can overlook the nasty lack of upkeep of the shop. The standing countertops are sticky and disgusting...don't touch the marbletop unless you have a layer of clothing between you and the table. There were a few other people who looked like they just left the club and were waiting for their $4.00 slice of goodness.

I got the veggie pizza but substituted the black olives for pesto--BEST DECISION EVER. There's no extra fee to sub a topping, so Napoli's gets two thumbs up for keeping it affordable. I was shocked to see that there were two young boys manning the phone and keeping watch on the cash register...yo, it's 11PM...aren't you supposed to be at home fast asleep? Question marks a-plenty for their parents who are probably running the restaurant. This place is clearly family-owned, so that makes this grimy shop seem less disgusting.

Delicious and large pizza slices for $4.00--no complaints there. But there are some interesting figures that come out to eat here at night, so be aware of that. However, Napoli's is still in an OK area on Polk Street, but I wouldn't come here alone after 10PM. With all of the negatives of the location/cleanliness, I would no doubt come back for the huge portion slice/yummy pizza.
author: Jodi H.

description: Honestly not great, I'm pretty disappointed. 4 dollars for a veggie slice and it's mediocre at best. The onion on the pizza wasn't even cooked all the way.
author: Olivia T.

description:
I enjoy a good N.Y. style slice, and here you can get that slice made to order, with any combination, and for quite the reasonable price!
Other pizza joints, slice houses you pick from what's made, here I order pesto for my sauce, or add it to the tomato sauce then I order pepperoni, sausage, onion and extra cheese for less than $6!!! (Single topping slices are cheaper!)
If you don't need a box, be kind to mother nature and just use a paper plate!
Happy dining and Yelping!!!
author: Sean M.

description: Worst pizza ever. The wings 80% fat. Eww the pepperoni on the pizza extra greasy and cheap ingredients. The pizza drenched in oil. The salad went to the trash what that heck was that. Everything was nasty.
author: Rosie Q.

description: First they are open late, late, late (however if they're busy late they won't take a credit card.) Second their delivery is usually really fast. The Pizza is good, not amazing, but really nice crust, enough cheese, good toppings. I order fairly often and have had good experiences. Their mood is sometimes gruff and hurried, but heck I just want a nice dinner so it's okay.
author: Walt A.

description: I tried the slice of cheese pizza and hawaiian salad. The cheese pizza was alright but nothing to write home about. The slice is rather big though so that's good. The hawaiian salad was very gross however and I had to throw it out. The lettuce seemed old and overall it tasted nasty. I guess that's what you get for a 4.40 salad.
author: John B.

description: $4 a slice. Crispy, tasty crust. Cheesy. Pesto-y. LOVE LOVE LOVE. We also got a whole pizza delivered the following night (around $20 for a large Greek) and it was just as good as ordering a slice in person. Bomb-ass pizza right here.
author: Paeng M.

description:
The pizza was horrible! The crust was like cardboard and the pizza sauce had no flavor. The only reason I would give two stars was cuz the hot wings were decent. If you want good pizza, don't go here. If you just need something in your tummy and they are the only place open, take my advice and starve! It's not worth the calories or the money!

Ordered the Napoli large pizza and hot wings.
author: Edward C.

description: I don't wanna give any star for this place. Owner is fucking asshole who don't give a shit about customer.
author: Urangoo P.

description:
I needed a late night delivery place and they delivered within 30mins. I've had a lot of different pizza's from different places and this place is definitely not the best, a tad salty, but satisfies a late night/early am pizza craving. They deliver until 3am and the pizza delivery guy was nice and the pizza was very hot. 
Not bad. Worth a snack!
author: Ness V.

description: We called for pick up to ordered 'Medium Calzones'. We had to say 3 times because a guy didn't catch what we wanna order. When we went to pick up we got Medium California..... we told  a guy and he yell on us and said we order Medium California! He said he is the owner. The old owner and his son are very nice and I didn't know when they change the owner.
author: Orange S.

description:
Maybe we were slightly intoxicated after grabbing a couple slices to go at the recommendation of our Sidecar driver (he literally pulled over on our way home so the bf could run out and get some late night grub), but this is some pretty good pizza.

As a disclaimer, I'm all about thin crust pizza. Deep dish is too much sauce, etc. and that regular thick crust makes me feel like I'm wasting the ends because it's just too much bread. However, THIS crust is definitely thin crust pizza (though not too thin). We have been here twice now and the cheese is definitely the winner. There's a good ratio of dough-to-sauce-to-cheese. The dough has a subtle flavor that just makes me want to finish the entire slice, crust and all. The second time we went, we got the pepperoni and while I couldn't put my finger on it, I think my bf figured it out: there was just too much sauce and not enough cheese.

Quick service and a solid late-night pizza place.

Bonus points for being open 'til 3AM. They know their audience!
author: Leana L.

description: What the heck has happen to you Napoli Pizza?!? The pizza I ordered (and the three other times I've ordered) was awful. There wasn't enough sauce and it was bland. The pizza was made quickly and wasn't rare or anything terrible, but it was bland. I guess something's missing in the sauce?
author: Audrey S.

description: Just seen the food review was goi g ro check it out but but food safty gave it a poor wow and i was starving looking through yelp big sign poped up with food healtg scores first time seing a poor
author: Todd B.

description: Before you eat this mediocre pizza, go ahead and walk half a block to Mustachio's. It's worth the extra buck a slice.
author: Liam R.

description: Ehhhhh pizza tastes fine, toppings wouldn't be considered a lot but not too little as well. Only issue I have is that he didn't wash his hands even one time between handling money, touching other things outside of the kitchen area, and making the pizza itself. He literally touched like 5 different things before making a pizza with his bare hands. Gross. Still ate because I have little time and I'm starving. If I throw up later, at least I know why. Also, $.75 cent charge for using credit/debit cards.
author: Logan T.

description:
Worst delivery service ever.

I ordered a pizza and soda and when the delivery was here, the driver called me when he was outside and told me to come down... The whole reason you pay for delivery is so it gets delivered to you AND it was raining and the main reason you don't go out to eat on rainy nights is because you don't want to go outside.

Then he finally came to my door and buzzed the doorbell for 30 obnoxious seconds and then I opened my door and watched him slowly walk up. He gave me the food and stared at the receipt. I asked if I needed to sign anything and he said yes.... But didn't have a pen. I put my COLD food down to grab a pen and as I am signing it, he tells me , "you live too far for us to deliver to". And I look at him, laugh and say ,"don't worry, you won't be having my business to come back to".

Very rude and awful service to a NEW customer. Never going back!
author: Cristina R.

description:
Came here after a full day of drinking and it was so good! Thick slice, plenty of toppings; fulfilling. 
Woke up and ate the rest of my slice and still delish! So it wasn't just the alcohol talking!
author: Ismael I. G.

description:
DELICIOUS...  CHEESY I got the  14' Pesto Special with sausage n pepperoni..(love the garlic)
 FRESH n Hot..  The crust Crisp yet soft.. I wish they would have put more veggies on ...that's why I rated it a 3 1/2 ..GOOD PIZZA
author: Leah W.

description:
Scenery-5.5
pizza 3.5
total experience 4.0

It's ok pizza and certainly better round closing time at 1.30am! The real treat of this non-frills get it and go place is all the prostitutes,trannys and street people.....drug dealers,rubber neckers,(checking you out for hustling purposes) and everything else you'd find in the Christopher Reeves movie,"Street Smart" .This is a true slob city kind of place.Sexual harassment and public health rules do not apply.I loved it! I don't think i would risk anything other than standard pizza preferences like sausage or pepperoni on top just to be safe.
author: Brian D.

description: Horrible food and lousy service. I ordered via Eat24hours.com. My order confirmation said 45-60 minutes. I got the food nearly two hours later. Napoli said they put 150 minutes on the confirmation to Eat24. The confirmation I got said 46-60. Anyway, food arrived and it was the worst ravioli I've ever seen or eaten. The spaghetti was lousy too. The raviolis tasted like and had the texture of frozen raviolis from a package. The meatballs also looked and tasted like frozen packaged meatballs. Come on we're in San Francisco and you serve frozen meatballs and frozen raviolis? Canned raviolis taste better than what they served. The salad dressing was not homemade it was store bought pre-packaged. The "garlic bread" was a warmed up roll similar to a hamburger bun with no butter and no garlic whatsoever - seemed like it was microwaved or came out of a bun warmer. Terrible food.  My husband's pizza was the only thing that was semi-decent.
author: Teri R.

description:
The pizza was a little chewy, but good. Good because I had been drinking.

As mentioned in several other reviews, this is a solid spot for a late night craving savings. You really can't beat the price, especially for San Francisco and for individual slices. My slice was hot and cheesy but definitely a little too chewy for my personal tastes.

So maybe it was a slow night and I just got a rubbery older piece, but to be able to critique pizza through the fog of inebriation takes a certain level of pizza quality. Unfortunately that level is at two stars. But three stars for being open late and being solid and price-positive in an otherwise expensive area.
author: Candice T.

description:
Civic Center has a ton of choices for pizza but this one is amazing!  I usually come here late at night after a night of dancing or even get delivery when I'm too lazy to cook.

I got delivery tonight and not only were they quick, the pizza was delicious!  Melted cheese and soft crust...yum!
author: Annie L.

description: The food here is so good!! I love the margherita pizza. I will go here a lot. The pecan cake was to die for.
author: Arden M.

description: If you're in SF and want pizza, stop by here! The pizza is the right amount of everything and it is so delicious!!!!! I honestly think that they make the best pizza ever it will not disappoint!
author: Janeisy M.

description:
We ordered pizza for 14 people at 8pm at night on a Wednesday and were told it would arrive in 30-45 minutes.

- 1 hour later we called to check on our pizza - "it's on the way"
- at 1 hour and 15 minutes - "it's on the way, it'll be 5 minutes"
- at 1 hour and 30 minutes - "it's on the way, it'll be 10 minutes"
- at 1 hour and 40 minutes - "let me check with the driver, I'll call you back", he didn't call me back.
- at 1 hour and 50 minutes - "it will be there in 7 minutes."
- at 2 hours - it finally arrived.

For our delay, no one apologized and we were offered $5 off only after we asked for a discount.  Finally, he gave us $20 off, though I hardly think that makes up for making 14 people wait for an hour and a half more than expected for pizza.

I've actually eaten here before, so it pains me to give such a bad review.  Sorry guys, you just lost any return business from some locals.
author: Colt S.

description:
We were staying in Frisco for the night and decided to get some food for the room. There were 2 choices and it was slightly after midnight so we called the other choice first and there was no answer after a couple of calls so we defaulted to this spot. After a couple of tries they finally answered the phone. They took my order and told me that they would deliver in about an hour. I was fine with that since it is usually 45 to an hour with most delivery spots anyways.

2 hours later I get a call and it rings once and hangs up. So I immediately call the number back and there is no answer.. I know it is the pizza guy because its a "415" number.. So I called several times and still got no answer. I also tried the actual Pizza place and still there is no answer there.. So I figure this is a BUST and then all of a sudden I get a text.. I text back saying where is my Pizza and Lasagna?? They text that they already tried to deliver and left.. WTF.. I was like oh well so much for that.. Long story short they ended up "supposedly coming back" and delivering my order at 4am. After getting it opened and trying to eat it we found that it wasn't really edible and to be honest it kinda is my fault for still excepting it after ordering 3 hours earlier...

A small part of me was hoping that they would have done like any respectable place and remade the order so it would have been fresh since they didnt correctly deliver it the first time..

So, If you are in Frisco and you decide to give these yahoos a try I would recommend eating in the restaurant and NOT ordering for delivery. It seems like everyone that went in and ate at the place had MUCH better luck and experience.
author: Rj H.

description:
Napoli's is the best when you're drunk from the bars on Polk and starving on your way home. This is me almost every other weekend so you could say I'm a regular. 

I've only had their cheese and pesto slices. Both are delicious but I personally prefer the pesto with chili flakes. They have many different slices a long with salads, pasta, sandwiches, etc. 

Be prepared to stand in lines possibly out the door in SF cold on weekend nights. Also be prepared to deal with drunken debauchery and possibly fights happening outside during this time of the week. You most likely won't find a place to sit after you receive your slice so grab it to go while you're at the counter. 

The people running the joint are very patient and sweet. The man running the place has his young son (or grandson?) helping out behind the counter on weekends and a few other younger boys running the back ovens. 

There are plenty of pizza places in the Polk area but I recommend Napoli's above them all!
author: Vidya K.

description:
Came here for late night snack around 2am on the weekend. There were already a lot of people there but the wait wasn't so bad. Took about 10 minutes to get my slice of pizza. 4 dollar for a piece of HUGE slice of pizza wasn't a bad deal at all. That was seriously the largest single slice of pizza I have seen. 

There were nothing really special about the pizza. The crust was pretty decent but the ingredients and the sauce were just standard fare. I had a slice of the San Francisco and it was very oily. This is not a pizza restaurant you would like to sit down and eat. There were only about 8 chairs inside. It is not a bad place for a quick bite late at night.
author: Mona W.

description: Not the best pizza but it does the spot after you've been drinking on Polk.  The pizza here is more doughy than I like and not as browned but still decent.  Got a huge combo slice.  Also seems that things are made to order on this popular stop post bar hopping.  75 cent transaction fee for card.  Two slices of pizzas...$7 cash.  The amusement of looking at the drunken hot messes waiting for their pizza & eating..PRICELESS.
author: Cat C.

description:
To sum it up in a nutshell, this place is a triple threat: quick, quality, and cheap!  It borders on 5 stars.

Napoli's open late, you can get pizza by the slice, and atleast when we stumbled in around midnight, all the pizza was made to order in the oven right behind the counter.  $4 for a jumbo slice = money!
author: Tricia D.

description:
This place deserves ZERO stars.
1) WRONG ORDER. Late night delivery order for chicken + pesto pizza (even willing to pay extra for the chicken). Received wrong pizza with chicken, pesto, olives, and mushrooms. 
2) FORGETFULNESS. Forgot the holy grail ranch sauce,  after we confirmed with them on the phone and when the delivery guy dropped off the pizza. 
3) HORRID SERVICE. We also called them several times to inform them that  we received the wrong pizza and wanted a new pizza. INACTION. Any place that cares about customer service and customer retention would deliver a fresh, new pizza to their customers. They did not apologize, did nothing to satisfy our complaints, and stopped picking up our phone calls. 
4) HORRIBLE PIZZA. On top of everything else, their pizza was not even good.
author: Christine Z.

description: Fabulous!! Quoted 45 minutes was delivery in less than 30!! Looks and smells fabulous! Delivery driver was ver accommodating!!!
author: Allison M.

description:
Inebriated pizza for inebriated people. 

Good cheese slices, served fast.
author: Emily D.

description:
super delicious pizza omg guys for real 
i had this with my gma and the dough was so yummy, thin but not burnt and all the ingredients werent swimming in cheese it had just the right amount of everything anyway if you want good pizza you have to be specific on how u want it and they will make it just like that!
author: Lana C.

description: I placed an order for a pasta dish and a couple salads. Somehow the restaurant was out of ALL of its pasta dishes on the menu and they waited 35 minutes after I placed the order to tell me this. The gentleman I spoke to was SO RUDE on the phone, did not apologize once and acted like he was the one being inconvenienced by my order. Horrible service. Don't order from this terrible excuse for a restaurant.
author: Allie S.

description:
I don't care what kind of shit people want to give this place - it's good pizza, it's super cheap, and it is only made better by the massive amounts of alcohol you've definitely consumed on Polk prior to eating here at like, two in the morning.

A plain slice with pesto for $2.50? Yes. I mean, come on.

The crust is much closer to true New York pizza (really important to me), being that it's crispy around the edges, thin (but not flat, practically cracker thin, like too many California pizza places tend to serve up), and flavorful enough to stand on its own.

I'd come back here sober. And that is an enormous compliment, considering I don't actually live anywhere relevant to Polk.
author: Jiordan C.

description: Worst pizza and phone service I've ever had. Pizza is a joke, I've had better out of the frozen food section at Ralph's. The hot wings? Are so bad that we gave them to the needy person by out hotel along with the whole large pizza minus the slice my GF and I tried. The garlic bread is a store bought sesame seed bun as you can see in the picture. Not only is this gross but the second truly disgusting part of our visit here in SF!!! And that's only between our hotel check and ordering food!!! Do not order from here unless they're giving away free food for the people on the streets here that actually need! Shame on you for calling this Italian food and that's coming from an Italian man!!!!
author: Brandon Z.

description: If you are looking for a place to eat late night, definitely suggest you to go! Delicious pizza, good price and friendly service!!!
author: Chris W.

description: One of the top three pizza places I've ever eaten at. Kind of a hole in the wall, but damn dat pizza. Good sauce, delicious cheese melted on top of whatever you get, and the crust is crispy to perfection and never burned on the bottom. Not thick, but not thin, a good regular crust size. One slice can fill me up, and at a great price.
author: Adamme K.

description:
I have to be honest, this pizza place isn't the best spot for pizza but it is the best place for late night pizza because it is open till 3am 7 days a week!

positives: best late pizza, slightly cheap at $2.50-$4.00 !

negatives: not that good for lunch or breakfast, would only say it's good for late night dinner or a late night snack, also the neighborhood is meh !
author: Food F.

description:
Looking back at my old yelp reviews I have to ask myself, why did I ever give this place 5 stars? The pizza is okay. The atmosphere is bad. There are frequently weird people hanging out here. The staff is barely friendly. 

Once my friend got drunk, bought a slice, and dropped it on the floor. He then proceeded to pick it up and eat it. He got very sick. The moral of this story is "Don't eat pizza that has fallen on the ground in the Tenderloin."
author: Aaron M.

description: Perrrrfect for late night! Our Uber had just dropped us off at our hotel, but we were HUNGRY! The hotel suggested Napoli's, so we walked over (about 1/4 a mile). The place was packed! I think it is the last stop for everyone!  Since it was close to 3am, our selection was limited to just cheese pizza...but it was actually really good. The pieces were huge, but that didn't stop us from eating two each.  It came with ranch too, for the crust which was really good. I would suggest stopping by on your way home one night!
author: Franceen H.

description: Worst pizza in the world.. If there is nothing else an you need something to eat great place..
author: Chasen G.

description:
I was extremely drunk when I consumed this pizza.  

But from what I recall, the crust was really soft, and the cheese/toppings were damn hot.  like scalding hot.  Which is what makes fresh pizza so wonderful.  

And it was pretty dirty in terms of like random napkins and trash on the floor.  But maybe that was us being drunk - I can't recall really.  

I will probably be back here (or bob's donuts) after another marathon night at Yamasho.
author: Jason J.

description: Decent, fast delivery service, but they took my phone order in such a hurry I didn't even have time to ask how they wanted me to pay. Then there was a problem when the delivery guy showed up and I needed to make a credit card transaction because I really didn't have enough cash. Meanwhile he was double-parked on a busy street, and in communication with his bosses whether it was OK to process my credit card. All this could have been easily avoided if they'd just asked me about payment in the first place.
author: Doubledang D.

description:
First impression: the cheese looks weird and the meats taste weird, implying the ingredients are not the finest, but I didn't mind because at 2am, I wasn't expecting anything fancy.  I ate one slice and had to get up in the middle of the night to throw up. Bad pizza is okay, but bad pizza that offends your stomach that much is not so cool.

On the plus side, they are fast and open late. It's your call.
author: Ringo M.

description:
Words cannot describe how upset i am! 
Last Sunday, my friend and I stayed at a hotel in SF, we ordered a small pizza and french fries from Napoli Pizza! They said they only accept cash and I don't usually carry cash with me, i only had a $50 bill. So when the delivery guy brought our pizza and french fries he gave me a $20, $5 and $2 bill. I tipped him well... Like i said i don't really use cash... so after a few days i bought something and wanted to pay for it with my $20 bill that the delivery guy gave me, GUESS WHAT! The $20 bill is COUNTERFEIT MONEY! 
I technically paid $50 for a small pizza and fries since the guy gave me counterfeit money! I so want my $50 back! 
IF YOU'RE ORDERING PIZZA FROM THIS COMPANY, MAKE SURE YOU CHECK THE MONEY THEY GIVE TO YOU!
author: Kavisha G.

description: Open until 3 and they deliver? Win. Decent pizza, you can't expect much at 2am so it's ok but the rude delivery guy demanded a tip before he even handed us the pizza.
author: Ashley Nicole C.

description: Dude hell Yah the pizza is awsome they been open for more than 20 years and the pizza still tastes the same very good the brick oven gives it a better taste
author: Jhon G.

description:
Ok you guys aren't too bad, but the location scares the crap out of me. Cant expect too much and its great that this place opens until 4am. After our night out we were looking for places to eat. This place was about a block down the place we stayed and we were starving! 

Pros: 
-made fresh 

CONS:
-homeless people everywhere! I was so scared of these people following my friends and I around asking for money. There was this one guy that told us never to come back and he was going to get us..so freaking scary...
-this place smells bad, and its not the cleanest pizza joint...
-kindapricey

I will never come back here again.
author: Vicky H.

description: It's all thick dough that makes your belly bump. Of course it's only 3-4 bucks and for that I didn't give it one star.
author: Omid A.

description: Place sucks !! I hung up on them, Don't waste your time. Whoever answered the phine was rude.
author: Gene P.

description: One of the best slices in town. Big slices with generous toppings! Try the Hawaiian and San Francisco
author: Fernando H.

description: Hospitable, great people working behind the counter. Pizza was delicious and the toppings were plentiful. Would come back over and over. Ask for Sam!
author: Christopher C.

description:
A couple of weeks ago I was across the street and a tranny hooker flashed me. 

I don't know why I just threw that in there. 

Where was I?

Oh yes- I was at Napoli with my date today and for $7 we got two slices of pizza and a drink. I'm all about cheap food. 

If you forget about the fact that there are crackheads outside and that you'll want to reach for that plastic knife because you feel a little threatened the pizza is pretty damn good. 

I really enjoyed the crust. 

If you see the pictures I posted you can see that it's a bit - dingy - but the pizza is good and cheap so it's all good.
author: Carlos A.

description:
For the area, and for the price, this place is solid. Good, basic service - and always a freshly dressed slice, $4 for a "San Francisco" is CHEAP given how high it's stacked.

Give these guys a try, you won't be disappointed.
author: James D.

description:
This is a review of delivery from Napoli Pizza. I've had food delivered from them a number of times.

Medium Meat Calzone - This is the main reason I order from Napoli. I really enjoy their meat calzone. The crust is very bready and, for me, it has just the right mix of ingredients (cheese, Italian sausage,pepperoni,salami and Canadian bacon. ). Some may think there is too much cheese. But for me, there is no such thing. The only thing I can complain about is that the smallest is a medium and their medium is actually very large. I can never eat more half and it doesn't hold up well for leftovers.

http://tinyurl.com/3ubf9a8

http://tinyurl.com/3mnmqac

Cheeseburger and fries - This is a very basic burger. It is almost assuredly from a frozen patty. I would not order from them for just a burger. There are plenty of other places with much much better burgers. But if you are hungry for a great calzone and a burger. I've had worse.

Chicken wings - Their wings are very average. They are dry. They are not made in a traditional way where they are flipped in a sauce. The spice is a little bland. They could use more kick.

http://tinyurl.com/3n8jlko

Garlic bread - This is actually not very good. It is basically just a soggy roll with some basic ingredients. It doesn't seem that any though went into it.

Delivery is always polite, professional, and prompt.
author: Mark D.

description: Best pizza hands down, I love there beef pepperoni pizza with pesto sauce. Yummmm! I usually drive 45 minutes for the pizza sooo worth it!
author: Mursal N.

description:
Nothing too spectacular or memorable about this pizza place. 

We ordered a large half pepporoni/half cheese for delivery. It came within about 45 minutes(pretty average for delivery) and the pizza wasn't too pricey. iT was overly greasy though. Even the cheese side was surprisingly greasy. I

I most likely won't go back just on the fact that there are several other pizza places with better prices and better quaility
author: Whitney S.

description: This place made my night. The delicious aromas of garlic, cheese and oven fired pizza wafted into my nose as I meandered down Polk at 2am beckoning me to come in for a slice. With fast service and great people and fabulous food, Napoli is a home run. The pizza was covered in a mix of mozzarella and parmigiana which was perfectly chewy and melty sitting atop marvelously crispy & doughy crust. Well worth the price.
author: Nora L.

description: Very good pizza, esp. after a night out on Polk St. My favorite in the area.
author: Krish P.

description: Negative on the food quality . Everything looked and tasted super cheap. Ravioli and hamburger patty tasted right out of bulk bag at COSTCO. hardly any meat in the pasta and the garlic bread was a sandwich bread with margarine spread stuffed inside.  HORRIBLE. AVOID at all costs. Waste of $40 when there are many other options in the city.
author: dylan R.

description:
Good pizza and cheap.  But it's not anything like the delicious pizza in Napoli, Italia!

The restaurant is a typical hole in the wall.
author: John M.

description: Family run delicious pizza place.  I've never had pepperoni by the slice that was this good.  Keep it up!
author: Bryan F.

description: First time was good, second time was just ok, third time was not a charm AT ALL. The dough was raw and they said they would comp is for our next order. Their idea of comping was $5 off. NOT COOL!
author: Jeff A.

description: First night in SF... got in very late and this was one of the only places open... interesting scene to say the least at nearly closing time lol. Pizza actually wasn't bad though. Was made fresh when I got there and wasn't too greasy. Perhaps it was just ok because it was late and I only had tacos earlier in the day. If you need a late night fix stop by and give it a try.
author: James B.

description:
This pizza was WONDERFUL!  They delivered it to our hotel and we just chowed down on it.  It truly was one of the best pizza we ever had.  It was not greasy at all. The ingredients were fresh and best of all, the pizza was still hot after we got it.

Please try it. You will not be disappointed.
author: Sweetpea M.

description:
They crank it out fast, to order, and they're open late. What more can you ask from a pizza joint, WHAT?? 

I order veggie slices sans cheese and if I'm in the mood to be theatrical I may say "crazy olives" or "hella onions" and they always come through. 

Sure, the crowd post midnight can have some crazy folk but I call that the Napoli Character Plus. I trade marked that term, don't steal it.
author: Justin N.

description: delicious. best pizza ive had in the loin
author: Kyle D.

description:
Not bad and they deliver late night which is ideal. We were given a menu with deals in it at the front desk at the Hyatt on Embarcadero so we gave them a whirl after being asked nicely to leave Lush Lounge on Polk... no we were on our best behavior surprisingly (me, the hot gay and 6 fun and very wild ladies from Ohio) it was just closing time.

Anywho, the pizza was pretty solid and kind of hit the spot, ranch and crushed red peppers would have been nice. We went for the 2 large 2 topping pizza for 28 (tax + delivery included) but we just wanted a pepperoni w/extra cheese and a mushroom (double the mushrooms). Pepperoni was fine but there were barely any mushrooms on the one I wanted to devour. The only other complaint was that their crust is a bit weak. Too fluffy and not much flavor. It's cool we aren't big fan of crust in general so no big loss but just a lot of waste... they should spread the sauce and cheese up higher to the edges I think. I loved my first three bites then it (crust) got to be too much especially when or if you fold it halfway which I do in hopes to keep the mess factor down. Pizza sauce was lovely and the topping themselves pretty good. 

Overall grateful for their late night delivery service and thanks, no hangover this morning!
author: Shiho F.

description: Without a doubt the WORST pizza I've ever consumed. Domino's, Pizza Hut and even Papa John's are better. All of their specialities are just a bunch of crap thrown on top of a standard cheese pizza. It's not even good drunk food. Avoid at all costs.
author: T.J. S.

description:
I don't know what was with this place but it was a disaster from the start. We were staying at a hotel in SF and placed an order for delivery. The guy that I talked to was so rude. He answered my questions with questions. I asked if they had soda/drinks. He said, "Yes." I asked, "What kind do you have?" And he responds (very rudely), "What kind do you want?" Really? That's customer service? No place else was open late and we were so hungry so we ordered an extra large pizza and two bottles of soda.

He told me he would call my cell when he got to the lobby of the hotel. He didn't. Instead he showed up at our room. When my friend went to take the pizza box at the door, he actually held onto it and let himself into our room and closed the door! There were four girls in that room but regardless, the pizza guy is not supposed to be letting himself into anyone's room unless he's invited! It was very creepy, especially when I walked out of the bathroom and found him just standing there looking at all of us (God only knows what was going through his head).

My friend paid in cash (the total was $27 and she paid with two $20 bills). He gave her change but we realized after he left that he took $10 for himself as his tip, even after we had chipped in $5 for his actual tip...so he walked away with $15. I'm pretty sure he thought we were all totally drunk and wouldn't notice. We weren't drunk, just very tired/hungry after partying so unfortunately my friend that paid didn't notice the missing money from the change until the next morning. But any honest pizza guy would have given her back the right amount and then taken his tip before leaving.

Do NOT order from these guys if it's between 1am-3am...they're probably going to hope you're drunk and/or high so that you don't realize they're ripping you off. Terrible!
author: Dania D.

description: Came here around past midnight with my friends after a concert on Halloween night. This was one of a few places that were open at the time and when we got there, there was a long line.  The location is pretty sketchy however the ambiance of the restaurant made me forget that I was in the Tenderloin. The place was super packed and busy but the service was fast and easy! Ordered individual slices for me and my friend, I got a combo pizza and my friend ordered the greek. When we got our order, both pizzas were attached next to each other and I was surprised that they made each slice individually and I thought that was pretty special and unique! Kinda wish I ordered a whole pizza because of how good it was, so I do plan on coming here again.
author: Mikka D.

description:
Im not usually a fan of thick crust but this pizza is actually pretty damn good. Its a a few blocks out of my way but its worth the trip. 

My pizza of choice when im on Polk.
author: Nelson S.

description: Avoid like the plague! They say they take credit cards, and do not! Plus dont expect delivery under an hour even if a few blocks away. They are open late not because they are good, but because they have to be to turn a dime.
author: Sharon M.

description: Why did a group of children (there were 3 kids around the age of 12) serve me pizza late at night? Also, why did I buy pizza from a group of children? I'm guessing it's their dad's/family's restaurant because I saw an adult there that may have been their dad or uncle. Um, anyway, the pizza was alright. It hit the spot after a late night of drinking.
author: Randi P.

description:
Yet another hole in the wall pizza joint owned by rude weirdos. 

It's better than Seniore's at least! Especially when after hitting the polk street pub crawl :P
author: Alex M.

description:
Why Napoli, right on polk in the TL with a barebones set up.  Don't know if i've ever been while the sun was shining but it has satiated my craving for Pizza after a concert or a late night. 

It's open into the late night and can be escaped to if there are too many creepers in the area.  A plain cheese slice runs about 2.50 and is moderate size and extra good if you ad a bunch of the red ground chilli stuff.
author: Matthew M.

description: it's been a few years (I'm SOWWY) since I ordered from Napoli simply because I haven't worked in the Tenderloin since 2008, but tonight at work, I was already starving so when my direct deposit hit my bank account, I was like YAY PIZZA! Let me tell you, Napoli's NEVER disappoints me with their food, I ordered a Medium Chicken, Garlic & Mushroom of course with jalapenos and pineapple added, I also ordered the Greek Salad which was quite yummy (needed more tomatoes though) I shared the pizza with my coworker and he agreed wholeheartedly, THEIR PIZZA is BOMB!!!! SO FREAKING GOOD! SOURDOUGH CRUST...sauce was yummy, just the right amount of garlic...I LOVE YOU GUYS!!!! Delivery guy was very polite!
author: Sakkara C.

description: We were looking for a good late night pizza place and our hotel recommend this one. It was yummy and perfect for a late night pizza fix( 11:30pm) -- delivered in great trimming too.
author: Ashley S.

description: Open late, but really definitely off the mark, no matter what kind of pizza you're aiming for. Really really thick crusts, and even though I'm usually a fan of this, it was leather-hard in parts, bland, and undercooked. The ingredients and the crust seemed like separate items, all barely glued together with way too much lackluster cheese. Maybe I need to drink before coming here?
author: Kevin L.

description: Unfortunately I ordered pizza today using the online sight through this yelp page. After charging my card and an hour and half goes by...No pizza. I called the store and confronted the manager and he got very aggressive with me over the phone. Stating that he is not responsible for any online orders. I asked for my money refunded and he began yelling at me that I don't listen to him.  It was a sad experience. I wont get pizza there if it were free! Customer service is hard to come by these days...
author: Janelle H.

description: Sitting at work and can't leave the store but we still needed to get a bit to eat. We used their online ordering service through yelp.com and received a confirmation that the transaction was completed and a pizza was on the way. 1 hour goes by and we called the restaurant to find out where our lunch was and they began telling us they did not get the order. We asked for a refund and they said they couldn't do it since we ordered on line. We had to call eat24hours.com for our refund. I'm not going to break into detail about how Napili pizza was treating one of my co-worker but let's just say no one wins arguments but companies can lose business.  I was hoping to experience their pizza but now it's just a pie in the sky.
author: Jason J.

description:
their pizza SUCKS!!
But the Crust is sso gosh TASTY!!!!
Which do yous perfer?
author: Der Maibaum L.

description:
This pizza is disgusting; even drunk I was able to tell it sucked. Overly greasy, not cooked through thoroughly, no taste - even the veggies on my slice were tasteless! Way too many olives piled on top - probably to give the slice flavor but it ends up providing way too much salt. 

Stay away from this place - even though it's the only place open when the bars close & it's packed...it's only packed b/c it's the only option. Do yourself a favor & raid your pantry at home & keep your hard-earned cash.
author: Marissa H.

description: I used to work in the financial district and we would go on staff nights on Friday nights. One time about ten years ago we stumbled into the TL and into this joint around 1AM. The place was tiny, but had a good vibe (although, the floor and wall designs caused some dizziness after drinking). We ordered some za and OMG it was fantastic! Since then, we would order them for delivery on a very regular basis. to make this place even greater, they deliver city wide and up until like 3am. if you like za and are in SF, check them out,. if you aren't brave enough to venture into the tenderloin, they will gladly come to you.
author: Matt R.

description:
Ugh, even drunk it wasn't that good.  As leftovers we took one look and tossed it.  Why oh why didn't I just call Victor's?
Stoked they actually delivered though - I always hate when I drunk dial for pizza and it just never shows up.  Just because I'm inebriated doesn't mean I don't really want the pizza, order takers.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Only had delivery from here...from work.  

It was good eating...greasy but in the good way--from lots of cheese and good flavors from the sauce.
author: Fannie S.

description:
I'm a racist when it comes to pizza crusts and if my slice is pale white without a touch of golden brown, I hate it.

Slices are huge - but they're always under cooked.
author: Nathan M.

description:
People like to say that sex is like pizza. Even when it's bad it's good. 

But, you know what? I no longer like bad pizza, and It doesn't lump me into the high-maintenance category. Bad pizza, with its sub-par toppings and low grade mozzarella... I'd rather walk to In-N-Out.

Napoli Pizza is not going to have you begging for round #2, but you probably won't kick it out of bed.

+1 star - Late night delivery.
+1 star - Tasty crunchy, yet doughy crust.
+1 star - FREE 2 Liter Soda, and 3 sides of ranch (generous).
 -1 star - Crust aside; Beer goggles couldn't make up for the rest.

Next time I need to absorb my bad decisions, rather than Napoli delivery... I'll stumble down to the liquor store, and make it a Digiorno night.

FTW Digiorno.
author: Courtney B.

description:
Napoli delivers late night which is a big plus when you don't want to battle the drunk zombies that come out at 2am.

Being a true meathead, I ordered the "California" which is essentially the meat-lovers pizza. Not sure of the reasoning or how appropriate the name is considering anything named California usually has avocado. This is more like the "Nebraska" with the dense chunks of beef and other meats.

The crust is thicker than most places but in a great way. The dough is fantastic, perfectly chewy and crusty but still perfectly complimenting the cheese and toppings. 

Delivery is a little slow but very solid pizza.
author: Ed L.

description:
Frankly, I'm a little flabbergasted as to how this place has received more than 1 or 2 stars.  I realize that its location (close proximity to a number of popular drinking establishments) may cloud one's recollection, but I can honestly and confidently say this was the most dreadful pizza I've ever had.

This place is set up for failure from the get-go.  It's filthy, dingy, and I immediately noticed upon ordering that the area where the pizza is prepared is concealed from view - not a good sign.  I ordered a slice of San Francisco, and Greek.  After waiting over 10 minutes, which, considering we were one of two parties in there at the time, was far too long, we received our "food".  Words can't describe how ghastly and revolting the pizza was when we received it.  It's clear that all they do is bake a number of plain cheese pizzas, and then create your slices once they're ordered by, and I shit you not, literally piling the additional ingredients on top of the pre-made cheese slice, and putting it BACK into the oven.  The problem is, they make absolutely no effort to conceal the fact that this is what they're doing.  The applicable ingredients are literally PILED on top; so high, in fact, that it's impossible to eat a slice without the ingredients falling all over the place.  Not to mention, the fact that the pizza is essentially baked twice results in an already mediocre cheese pizza slice being further ruined.

Honestly, people, stop abandoning all standards merely because you've been drinking.  There are infinitely better options on Polk, including pizza.  In a city that features actual pizza, like Tony's, there's no excuse for this crude, awful detritus.
author: Cameron Y.

description:
Ehh it's pizza. Not my favorite thing to eat. Napoli Pizza reminds me of Nizario's Pizza...maybe it's because they both start with the letter N. 

Anyway, great place for drunk munchies. Reasonably priced for the large slice of pizza they give you. The Hawaiian slice was what my friend got and I ate some with her. Too cheesy, too simple, not really anything unique or special ingredient that makes them, Napoli. The pizza looked really bland and flavorless. 

The only good thing about this place is that it is open late so you can pig out after all that drinking and partying.
author: Katrina T.

description:
This is a review by a vegetarian

It's a doughy baked thing with something red & sweet and something off-white and sticky on top.

Avoidance of one-starness because it stays open late and because it's holding below $3 for a decent sized slice.

Although it's possible the scuzzy low-class customers are a consequence of the location, I believe that the whatever-we're-just-a-pizza-joint-for drunks vibe given off by the place would result in the same clientèle were the storefront to relocate to the poshest residential neighborhood or the back of an industrial park.
author: Bob R.

description:
Napoli Pizza reminds me of Blondie's back around 2006-cheap, delicious, and HUGE slices! 

Napoli is truly a great pizza location. If you crave pizza and live within a few miles, located off of Polk and Post within the Tenderloin area, is this fantastic place. Although the place itself isn't phenomenal, the taste and food itself tells another story. 

The pizza is amazing. If your in for a very affordable meal, you can order for delivery the pizza of your choice and the largest costs around $20, well worth the cost as the slices and size are large. 

The cheese is delicious and soft, melting off the pizza when eaten fresh. The crust is baked to perfection. It's nice and soft, or crispy yet delicious. The staff is friendly and will make your pizza to your wishes. Their delivery is fast and makes for a good late night meal if in the mood.
In addition to pizza, there are other options as well such as sandwiches, pastas, or salads and are all worth trying.
Also, be aware of any deals or coupons available as they are really generous with their specials and can receive a free 2-liter soda! 

Napoli is a genuine pizza spot and should be tried out if your in the area. Luckily, if you indulge heavily, 24 hour fitness is right up the block so you can work off the tasty calories you may consume.
author: Jesus A.

description: Wow!  Ok, first off don't be skeptical of this place because of its location or some of the off reviews.  The truth is I ordered my first time from here today and found it far superior to all the other midrange delivery pizza places here.  The crust is great and tastes homemade.  This it not some chain or cheap cardboard style crust.  The toppings were very generous, flavorful and a much higher quality that similar places.  The sauce was lovely....good flavor.  The price point is below all others in the area.  In short, the value here is the best you will find in NW SF.  In addition, the delivery man was very quick to arrive and friendly.  Order from here and get 25% better quality at 20% less cost.....and an awesome pizza!  The wings.....I thought they were great.  Expect very tender, soft, moist wings, not the harder ones you get in restaurants.  Just give this place a try.....it defies what I somewhat expected from a Tenderloin low priced pizza place.  So good!
author: John B.

description: Great late night pizza, miles above other nearby pizza places. Open late.
author: Chris G.

description: Hands down my favorite pizza place in SF. I used to live down the street from here a number of years ago and then moved to the north bay. Anytime I am working in SF I stop by Napoli for a slice before I drive home. They never skimp on toppings....great size slices and nice guys who run the place. Highly recommended after a bar crawl on Polk street!
author: Ryan S.

description:
This review is based on delivery experience only, as I've never been to the actual location.

To start, the pizza is consistently good (over the past 2 years, I've ordered from them about 10-15 times). The cheese is all melty and gooey - just the way I like it. Additionally, I'm usually not a crust person, but their pizzas are the exception - crispy on the outside, chewy on the inside. The delivery people are very punctual and polite. Plus, the free 2 liter of soda is pretty sweet. My only hesitation here is their garlic bread. I love garlic, but found some bites to be overwhelmingly garlicy while other bites were pretty bland. To be fair, I only ordered it once, so it may have just been an off night. 

To sum it up: Great pizza, friendly people, great delivery hours, free soda, iffy garlic bread.
author: Deidre E.

description: Chef didn't care, pizza was gross after three slices. Not enough cheese and dough was only thing tasty.
author: Cameron J.

description:
Let me be honest..... very honest with you yelpers I was drunk nope not only drunk but very drunk on Saturday night coming back from a party on Union Street, we hungry, btw we were four people - the driver was not drinking that night which is always save! We stop by post and Polk and part our car, no parking in the area even at 2am but we managed to find a place to park it on a small street next by. each of us had a different slice - combo-chesses-meat and san Francisco slice (love the name) what was interesting at this pizza place that they use a big oven to heat the pizza before they served it, it take about 10- 15 minutes before the pizza is ready but waiting drunk it not easy but the pizza get crunchy taste after it being baked for few minutes. The pizza with excellent crust fresh and hot! 
I think they have the lower price for a good pizza in the city. 

Lower price - high quality - well I am in!
author: James A.

description: Great late night, awesome price point pizza !   We usually get the "San Franciscan"  [Pepperoni, bacon, olives, beef and Feta cheese.]
author: John W.

description: The best pizza i ever had in San Francisco. The location is not that good for sure but the owner is a kind hearted guy very smiling and he puts his heart into making the best pizza. I would highly recommend these guys
author: Jennifer L.

description: Ordered delivery on a rainy Saturday night in and gave this place a try based on reviews. Used Eat24 to order a large half and half pizza - one half peppers and sausage, and the other half peppers, onions & mushrooms. It came in only 45 minutes (+1 star), but we were disappointed to open the box find it was an unevenly distributed 100% POM pizza - no sausage (-1 star). And we paid extra for each topping (-1). The extra sauce we'd requested was also missing (-1). But we were starving and didn't want to deal with it, so whatever. Unfortunately, it turned out to be pretty mediocre pizza (-1). The crust was doughy and heavy, the sauce was pasty and the cheese was chewy. Didn't even want the leftovers the next day.
author: Victoria L.

description:
ok, so my hangover ritual consists of Law and Order Marathons (any flavor) and some sort of delivered food.   This is my go-to in the pizza bracket.  

First of all, it's close to the chosen situs- my couch.  or, in the neighborhood, however you want to say it.  Second, the pizza is GREAT.  my FAVORITE crust!  they are generous with toppings and the prices are splendid.  NOT greasy.  (the pizza, not the prices)  my favorite is the Hawaiian, second fave is sausage mushroom and olive.  

great, now i'm hungry.
author: Alison R.

description:
I'd have to say the pizza here is Grubbin!

I randomly stopped by Napoli when I was "Starvin Marvin" and I just happen to see "Napoli Pizza...Pizza by the Slice" sign.  So I illegally parked my car in the bus stop in front of the pizza joint and ordered a Cheese Slice and and Combo Slice.  Like most pizza joints the slices are usually just a cheese slice and they add the toppings on after you order.  My combo slice was overflowing with sausage, pepperoni, salami, onions, olives, bell peppers and another layer of cheese!  I loved the crust as it was not too thick and not too thin.  It had a thick crispy layer to it where when you picked up the pizza it wouldn't go limp.  My cheese slice was just as awesome and had great flavor.

Although the location is somewhat ghetto-fied (what do you expect, its in the TL) its a great place to grab a slice.  Just across the way are liquor stores, smoke shops and a gay sex toys/porn shop.   Enjoy!  LOL
author: Henry S.

description:
3.5 stars for now.
Easy to order online. 
Fast delivery on a weeknight.
Good pizza (salami, mushrooms, artichoke hearts, fresh garlic). 
Crust is tasty.  
Sauce is good.  
Toppings are a-ok.  
Free 2-Liter!

Will order again!
author: Tysen C.

description: Gave this place a chance based other reviews, and had them deliver me some 'zza.  The pizza was "OK" but not the best I've had.  Dough was thick and tasted a little "doughy" - I was born and raised in the Northeast, and favor thinner pizza ("New York Style") so I am a little biased.  But the delivery was quick and the pizza was hot, so overall a good experience.  Still, I think there is better pizza to be had in this neighborhood.  On a scale of Yuck to Great, I'd give it a "meh."
author: Zack B.

description: Perfect food for a drunken good time. PIzza is definitely tasty. Nothing you should go out of your way for but damn good for 2am in the Tenderloin. Service was fast and our wasted group was extremely satisfied.
author: Lucas L.

description:
It's not delivery it's Napoli.
Wait, it is.

No complaints on the pizza.  It's on the thin side, but not thin crust pizza.  It had a good balance of cheese and sauce and it was flavorful.  The crust was chewy and good.  I'd come here again.
author: Po L.

description:
Um. My cute new faux-suede boots are covered in oregano. 

This is what happened. I was drunk. I ordered a piece of pizza with pepperoni on it. I bought my lady Amanda V. a piece of cheese pizza. Here's the thing....I don't really eat meat. I mean, I eat it. But not much. But I ordered pepperoni just to spite people accusing me of being a vegetarian. I'm spiteful and dumb like that.

But whatever. I really think Amanda V totally set me up. She put oregano on her pizza, and as I was putting crushed red pepper on mine, the entire container of oregano fell and literally smashed all over the floor, covering my cute boots. 

A dude working there swooped in from out of nowhere and, like a ninja, swept up the mess in 10 seconds. I felt terrible. But he was so good at it, that obviously that kind of thing must happen there a lot. 

The rest of the meal is kind of a blur. The pizza was hot, and the pepperoni was greasy. I remember thinking "Maybe I shouldn't be eating this." But, as always, I scarfed that shit down like it was gonna be my last meal.

Fast-forward to the next morning, and Amanda is ill. Like, bad. The whole way back home, my stomach is churning and thinking about exploding.

Three stars, though. Because when you're drunk, anything will do. And I still feel bad about that oregano, but now my feet smell like a pizza! Yum!
author: Pamela D.

description: I placed a delivery order and got the Cheeseburger, which sucked. The patty was like a rubbery dog chew toy. My buddy ordered the meat ravioli which was supposed to come with buttered bread... bomb right? Well we get the saddest, limpest looking slab of hot dog bun ever. Not even toasted, soaked in butter. And sorry for the details, but when I unwrapped the bun it smelled like farts. So gross. P.s. we were drinking earlier and this food was still crappy. Try somewhere else, save yo $krill.
author: Insert N.

description: This place is gross. They leave the uncooked dough by the bathroom.  "I will have the samonilla slice and a fresh pound of the drugs too".
author: Christopher C.

description: Ordered pizza and it took them over an hour. Then delivery Man was going to make us may for our incorrect order! Very inconsidered . We asked to only may for the.bread since that was the Only thing correct and he didn't.let us. He said.we would.get no discount and.needed to pay for the ordered yet it was not what we order. We called them back and the Manager lied when we called.and.said oh it was mistake.delivery man downstairs  with your ordered.
author: Alvarez C.

description: I have eaten at this place numerous times being drunk in the Tenderloin and have enjoyed that is open late.  The Tijuana slice has done me very well on multiple occasions.  This last time though, while staying at Club Quarters and ordering a pizza to the room, I was not impressed.  Won't order a greek salad again when getting delivery pizza; probably my fault for expecting much.  The pizza we ordered was lacking in the cheese department and could have used more pepperoni.  Props to being open so late and actually delivering.
author: Cole M.

description: I have been going to this pizza since 1999 & I love their slices. But these guys are terrible over the phone. They also seem to use old dough on there pizza sometime. I am not sure , but it taste & looks like sometimes. I would give more stars if the attitude & the dough would change.
author: Mich W.

description:
5 stars because this place is located in SF. The stars would definitely go down were it in philly and they might just disappear in NYC but we are in SF and it's a matter of comparison kids so just be weary you NYCers out there....if you be readin this.

A friend from home also discontent with most SF pizza stops recommended this to me months before I accidentally happened upon the place. Now when that actually happened, sometime after leaving the Edinborough guess what state I was in? Aww, you got it right. Good for you!

"God damn this pizza's good," said my Socal friend who could not resist taking bites of her slice while driving. 

"This is way more like it is back home," I said.

"When are we going to NYC again?"

"Soon."

Well I hit up an average spot in NYC and yes my whole body melted, but until my next trip the fluffy crust, and hit you over the head sauce and cheese at Napolis will hold me over.

All I can say is, thank god I have this in my life, little as it may seem to you......thank god.
author: Alexandra M.

description:
Greasy and dependable.

But damn...the cheese was so fekkin' hot that it burnt off a piece of my lower lip.  At first I wasn't sure if it was cheese or my lip skin...so I ate it....and It tasted sorta like chicken.

...gives a whole new meaning to: "you are what you eat."  Does eating your own lip make you a cannibal?   Discuss.
author: Mc Matty b.

description:
Definitely the BEST pizza in San Francisco! I am a huge fan of their slices, their whole pizzas are great too, but there is something about eating that huge slice of deliciousness! The wait is a bit long sometimes, but I'd rather wait and know that it really is fresh! I always get the California and it is better every time!

*The slices are only like $3 and well worth every cent!
author: Henriette P.

description:
A wiser person than I has said 

"Never eat at a restaurant where the cook is skinny."

You will not run that risk here.  A solid performance.
author: Cassio P.

description:
This place is good for it's 1) price 2) location 3)hours 4)that doughy biscuit crust

I don't know how many times I had a hankerin' for this pizza at 2 in the morning. They have crust that makes you think about it days later. Biscuit-like, soft, buttery...Their toppings--EH, but that crust...

My apartment used to be 2 blocks away and I'd eat here all the time after embarrassing drunken moments at the Hemlock Tavern or Edinburgh Castle. 

Once i brought my slightly more conservative friend here and 2 homeless guys got into a tussle. One guy bonked the other with his cane, leaving one guy with a wound that bled profusely from his head onto the floor of the restaurant. No one even blinked and kept eating. Only after 2 yupsters from a bar on the corner complained did the owners lay down some pizza boxes for them to walk over the blood. Ahh, such are the foibles of the Tenderloin.

Still, the owners seem unfriendly at first, but they really warm up to you once they recognize you. This is not a place you take a date and not for any kind of fancy dinner, but it's oh so perfect when it's late out and you want cheap pizza.
author: BleepBloop P.

description:
3.5 stars.

I'd like to first say that I'm not a huge pizza fan.  If I had to pick a type of food to eat, pizza is never on the list.

So I don't really know the difference between good crust/ bad crust takes like.  I know I enjoy my pizza cold than hot and I remember liking the shitty pizza I got served at school when I was 8.  I think it's all relative anyway.

Aside from that I was craving some pizza and Napoli  was the best reviewed joint that delivered (boo the $2 delivery charge) nearby.  I ordered a plain ol' large cheese pizza and got a free 2 liter drink out of that (boo that it was Pepsi and not Coke like advertised but I'll let it slide NOITDOESNOTTASTETHESAME!)

I kinda like the pizza.  The crust has a nice crispy chewiness to it.  It's not too heavy on tomato sauce (ick) though I could do with more mozarella cheese.  And red chili packets.

The food took about 40 minutes to deliver.

*wipes grease from keyboards*

I suppose I'll order from here again if I had to, if I was craving pizza.
author: Walerz B.

description:
Update again:  Who have they been blowing in the health department?  Now they have 100%?  Have they really cleaned up their act or what?

Update:  I've recently been checking the health code violations for restaurants that I've reviewed, and this one gets a 45 / 100 by the health department.  That's the lowest I've seen.

http://www.dph.sf.ca.us/eh/Violations/Loc_CurrentViol.asp?LocationID=320

By comparison, almost every restaurant gets 85 or higher.

Even though the pizza tastes OK, 1 star.  Blatantly disregarding the health of your customers will do that.

Original review:

The actual place is dicey, and the pizza is greesy and probably doesn't use top notch ingredients, but it's actually pretty tasty when you're in the mood for a big glob of greesy goodness in your stomach.

I've only been there sober, but I could imagine that the percieved good-ness of this pizza goes up exponentially with each beer you've imbibed.
author: Rocco B.

description:
After drinking Red Stripes at the Elite Event at Bollyhood, then partying with yelpers at the Elbo Room, I decided a nice walk back to my brother Mike's apartment was in order. A nice 3 mile walk. I was hungry, and I figured I'd stumble upon some closing time food along the way, but was starting to get nervous as I hadn't seen a hot dog vendor, late night burger joint, or even a taco stand anywhere. Cripes people! When I leave a bar in Seattle I can be assured of a hot dog with cream cheese from a myriad of vendors up and down 1st in Belltown or Pioneer Square, or a Dick's burger in Queen Anne or Capital Hill... maybe I don't know SF well enough.

Anyway, I headed up to Polk and was walking along when a couple drunk dudes stumbled by munching on the most incredible smelling pizza ever. With mouths full, they told me to head over to the pizza place a block up. 

Napoli seems kind of a utilitarian experiment: its sole purpose seems to be to provide hot pizza to drunk patrons with no care for aesthetic. The guys behind the counter weren't all that friendly, but holy crap the pizza was good. I had a slice of the 'San Francisco' and a slice of cheeze and a vita water. Hot damn it made the next 1.5 miles of walking a cheesy pizza eating splendor.

So... this definitely ain't the place to take a date if you're trying to get laid. But it definitely is the place to take a date if (s)he had too much to drink and needs to sop up some of the alcohol before you do try to get laid.
author: Will L.

description:
Napoli's is yummy pizza after hitting nearby bars.  Other than the usual cheese and pepperoni, they have a selection of other types, including Ed's reference to the infamous San Franciscan with fetacheese (you MUST speak it as one word).

I come here for pre- and post-libation eats.  The pizza is reliable regardless of what state you're in:

Drunk rating: 5
Sober rating: 3.89
author: Marsha Z.

description:
I can't speak to how good or bad this pizza is when you eat it there...but if you have it delivered be prepared for a pile of crap to arrive at your door. 

I have given it zero stars in order to bring their rating down and save anyone from making the mistake I just made.
author: Adam F.

description:
Horrid Pizza. Horrid People. 
Delivery took forever.The  pizza and the chicken wings were soggy and disgusting. I called and asked for a refund. The driver  showed up with..another pizza. I told him we didn't want it. He put me on with his boss actually wanted me to produce the first pizza and YELLED  at me for throwing it out? I should have been outraged but it was so surreal and bizarrely funny that I couldn't find my rage. Trash food . TRASH People.
author: Vivian G.

description: Great pizza, get it 'well-done' for the full heat.  Gets crowded late night, but well worth it if you're in the area.  Yum.
author: Peter N.

description:
I had to play some guessing games here, because I can never remember the name of this place. An ideal late night stop for any after bar adventures.  

Average prices for average pizza by the slice. They have several selections, along with what I can remember is a burger (never tried it!)?

So this place is guaranteed to be open to satisfy your alcohol munchies. You are also guaranteed some tenderloin entertainment on the streets.
author: Catherine O.

description: Never had delivery from these guys but I can tell you that a slice or two from this joint definitely hits the spot after a night of drinking at the bars on Polk. Always lots of trannys trying to flip the straight club shirt guys too, classic entertainment. If I was at home and I had my choice I would choose Victor's but when I need some sponge to soak up all those wild turkey and cokes at 2:15, this spot does the trick nicely.
author: Tommy P.

description:
3.5 stars....I'm pretty picky about pizzas. This one was alright - decent price, not too tomato-y, pretty awesome crust. I got a pepperoni and I thought the meat looked a little suspect which definitely docked a star. I don't want to eat meat that I don't trust! 

After eating a few pieces I definitely got a weird headache (sometimes melted cheese does that to me though) and a strange rumbly stomach. I suppose we'll see how it tastes after sitting in my fridge for 2 days!
author: Tam G.

description: Wow...this place has some great Dough. The dough they use has a very unique and tasty flavor. This place rocks for slices!!! Prices are great and they stay open late! Try their Sausage & Garlic pizza! mmmmm
author: Eddie G.

description:
This $&!# is good!
I don't care how many homeless drug-addicted trannys i need to wait in line with.... This $&!# is good!
author: matt l.

description: For a CHEAP,quick late nite slice. You can't ask for too much. Cheese is oily,ingredients seem okay. If you "only" can stomach high end pizza. This isnt the spot for you. With that said... I have tried the seafood pizza with clams and garlic. It was good. Never hand clams on a pizza. So I thought what the heck!  Hey what can you expect from a semi grab and go spot. Not your trendy pizzeria. So if your looking to impress yourself or others :) might want to check another spot. Even though some have mixed feelings about the location being in the Tenderloin. I can say with all the interesting characters that frequent this joint. The gentlemen that runs it is always cool with me. And as for the youngsters running the till. Some may have mixed feelings about this,but I dont have a problem with this! Cause in some countries, people have the silver spoon not just in there mouth but some where else. And could probably learn a little something. Haha! Service is pretty quick too. Consistent in their product. Remember you get what you pay for. And yes I gave it 3 stars, cause as pizza conissuier. I have to keep it real!
author: Sage B.

description:
I ordered pasta with meat sauce and it was so bad I handed it back and waked out. Honest. The sauce had to be out of a can. Thee worst ever!

I don't know bout there pizza but I am never eating there again.
author: Jeff S.

description:
Napoli pizza is one of my favorite in the city.  

here's why:

Thick crust
Lots of cheese 
Not stingy on the toppings
Cheap eats
Across from Polk Gulch - ha, you can stare at a poster of a man in his red briefs while eating.
Great people watching
author: Lauren C.

description:
Do you remember that Seinfeld episode with the soup nazi? Well this place is their pizza equivalant.

Dudes are right stressed and don't have a moment for ya, besides to take your order, then bustle back to whatever unurgent task they were tending to, ever so urgently (i'm serious watch them!) but who care's cause they make some GREAT PIZZA.

Dough is fresh, tossed in front of you, thick or thin, and loads of good fresh cheese. Plus they have a cooler with all kinds of drinks, not your average coke, sprite, orange selection. 

They are open late enough for a slice after drinks at Hemlock Tavern and even later on the weekends.

They don't advertise it, but they do a large two topping carry out special for 10 bucks... Holla !
author: The Shmooze ..

description: I ate here yesterday on my lunch break and an hour later i was so sick that I could die. I couldn't leave work so I just had to stay at work in misery! It was awful! The person who ate with me at lunch also got sick. WTF??
author: robin l.

description:
First of all, I probably wouldn't go out of my way for this stuff, but I was conveniently down the street at R Bar watching MNF last night and decided to grab a slice during half time.  WOW...what a nice surprise.  I was a little sketchy walking into the place as it's on the edge of crack-ville, but when we entered I noticed the size of the dudes behind the counter and that's all I needed to see.
