They were happily fat by eating way too much pizza in their lifetime and looked like they loved what they do.  All the ingredients tasted fresh.  The dough/crust was yummilicious.  The cheese was not piled on so high that it made it nasty and greasy.  I did not feel guilty eating it, unlike Xtreme or any of the other crap that's around the city.  

R Bar = MNF = Napoli's Pizza

GO CHARGERS!!!!!!
author: Ayrn H.

description: These are some hefty slices! Should've only ordered one instead of two. Got the SF and the Combo. Although not the most delicious ever, a pretty good deal for $4 a slice! A short, slightly scary walk from the GAMH, if you're hungry before or after a show.
author: Maximillian M.

description: This place is a total hole in the wall and in a bad part of town, but has one of the best slices in the city, hands down.  The crust is fairly bready, but delicious, so if you are more into thin crust you won't like it.  I like it better than Escape from NY, Extreme, and Victors (up the street).  There are always pretty shady characters hanging around this place and I'm pretty sure there's a crack house across the street, so I would not advise women to go here alone late at night.  You can order delivery through Eat 24.
author: Andrew E.

description: A very conspicuous neighborhood. $2.50 for a very large cheese slice.  Not particularly thin and not particularly flavorful.
author: Jeff J.

description:
It's a good thing that pizza, like sex, is always pretty good, even when it's bad.

Napoli is cheap, but you get what you pay for.  There's really nothing special about their pies; I found them to be painfully bland.  Furthermore the cheese always slides off...sloppy pies are okay but only when they're good.  I hate to slam restaurants in reviews, but thse pizzas put you to sleep.
author: Nate H.

description: I  don't understand thin crust pizza lovers. Nor do I trust them. How can someone NOT love a soft, thick, warm crust like Napoli's?? The only draw back about Napoli is that their pepperoni pizza is a little too salty for my palate, but  if you're just another intoxicated patron stumbling in after your "wild" night on Polk, you probably won't mind so much. Have at it cowboy.
author: Gabriella C.

description: This is one of the best pizza places I've eaten at in SF. Absolutely fresh and delightful...and appearances by charismatic locals certainly adds to the atmosphere.
author: Bootylicious J.

description:
This is the best fast, casual pizza place I've so far found in SF. Two things stand out about Napoli Pizza:

- The crust - Warm, soft, doughy, and delicious
- The sauce - Don't know what they use, but flavorful and tasty

I have been coming here for years and have never been disappointed. The guys who are behind the counter (WHO have been there for at least 15 years) are friendly and helpful, considering the crazies and trash that must come in from the rather sketchy area (but I've never had a problem).

I'm a basic pizza kinda guy so their plain cheese or pepperoni are super. Their California special pizza has a great mix of veggies. And soda is only $1. Try getting that elsewhere.  A medium for $12 is a deal in this city.

The Polk area around Napoli is rapidly becoming a rising yuppie night spot with emerging bars. It will only be time before it's run over with Mojito-swilling Muffies who need a slice before they crawl home. So get to Napoli before it becomes the latest trendy Yelper spot.
author: Dont Call It Frisco D.

description:
BEST pizza in SF!!!  i don't get the neg reviews.... you can't beat this pizza, it's superb, delicious, and, if you want, customized. I had it delivered to my hotel and t has been the best pizza i have had for years (and I've had alot, including nyc). The "meat lovers" is awesome, and i usually don't eat the meat pizza.... Delicious, great customer service, superior, top of the line quality.  Best pepperoni 

cheap-o-s stick with dominos.
author: Luag Hong I.

description: We arrived at the hotel late and hungry and the front desk suggested Napoli for delivery. I'm happy we don't LIVE in SF....my ass would be gigantic because I LOVE their crust...it was topped with tons of cheese. The salad was inexpensive and it wasn't iceberg...it was full of olives, mushroom, and tomatoes. Man, that was a good meal. Fast delivery. Super friendly delivery person. Priced right. I am happppppy and full!! Because I was in my jammies when the delivery person came...I'd say the dress is casual. Gotta love that.
author: Dawn G.

description: The pizza is not very flavorful at all. It is a pretty heavy slice of pizza though. It comes out very warm but not it's not as good or as fast as blondies. $3 for a slice of pepperoni. Also they only had one set of pepper and oregano shakers, and the guy before left both super greasy so i had to use them carefully. Probably wont come back.
author: vishal k.

description:
Cheap pizza served at hours that suit my drunken self.  

Sandwiches with lots of mayo the next day suit my hungover self.

I eat here because they're close, cheap, and the guys behind the counter make the crackheads outside not bother me when ordering.
author: Mary R.

description:
Pretty much the greatest pizza place in San Francisco. I have traveled here many a drunken night -- nearing 3am -- only to find the cheesiest, most delicious piece of pizza that has ever graced my veggie-loving mouth. 

Not only are the slices cheap, but they are nice as long as you have your order ready and don't argue with them, as many drunk ladies will when they think their ten dollar bill was really a twenty, which happens almost every time I am there late on a weekend (which is more than I care to admit).

Anyways, bottom line: delicious, recommended, cheap.
author: Syd V.

description:
I know their name says "pizza" in it, but I have to say, I didn't like their pizza. I got a medium veggie and shared it with my companion, and she agreed she didn't really like it either. In fact, I would take a frozen Tombstone or Pizza Hut pizza over it any day.

HOWEVER, on a lazy and cold evening, we decided to order some "other food" on their menu and have it delivered. I can't remember if the minimum order for free delivery is $10 or $15, but either way it was worth it. She ordered the Spaghetti and Meatballs, and I ordered the Lasagna. Both were the "complete dinners", which the menu says includes bread and butter, and salad.

When the delivery guy came, we were hungry! But I wasn't expecting much, considering we didn't really like their pizza. We were pleasantly surprised! The salads that came with dinner were HUGE! We probably could have had those salads by themselves as meals! But the only downside is that they put the dressing on beforehand, which made the lettuce soggy, and there was just too much italian dressing. Next time, ask for it on the side.

Bread & butter was two huge slices of bread each (looked like sub sandwich bread, haha) and butter already on them, melted. Mmm. What can I say, I love me some carbs!

My lasanga was FANTASTIC. It was absolutely COVERED in cheese. That is to say, though, if you don't like cheese, don't get the lasagna, because it was cheesy. BUT I LOVED IT! That itself was huge, if I wasn't so damn hungry, it could have also been split into two meals.

I tasted the spaghetti and meatballs, and it was pretty good too!

All in all, you can order the lasagna complete meal for $9 and actually split it into two or possibly even three meals (if you don't eat that much). Which is definitely well worth the price!
author: Kim K.

description:
There's nothing spectacular about Napoli, but I've found it to be a good 'go to' spot whenever I need to grab a quick bite before a show at the Great American Music Hall, or if I'm walking home from work & not in the mood to cook.

Granted, I'm from New York & thus cursed/spoiled by legendary NY pies, so a three-star review for pizza out here is pretty solid for me.
author: Pete J.

description:
It's past 2 a.m., I am buzzed, and the stomach is yearning for greasy goodness. NAPOLI PIZZA! Da-amn, I freakin' love this place. I originally discovered it when a couple friends and I told a cab driver to take us to pizza (yes - to pizza) and he dropped us off in front of this piece of heaven. 

I've only ordered the veggie pizza and I'm never ordering anything else. The crust is soft, the toppings plentiful and the slices the perfect size.

I'm almost afraid to come here when it's not past 2 a.m. Yes, one concern is that it won't taste as good when I'm sober (see Clover Grill review below). But the other is that I will miss out on the free entertainment this venue provides - from the b&t folk blasting the stereos out of their SUVs, to the lonesome rapper trying to sell his CD on the sidewalk, to my favorite - the threesome of the large round-bellied Italian man standing in between two "transvestite" hookers (or to be PC - two "powerful" looking women with a taste for dramatic make-up and un-modest clothing), eating his pizza while they affectionately hold onto his arms.
author: Dalia K.

description:
Working graveyard shift near around the neighborhood, I find myself naturally dialing Napoli's number. 
$5 burger with grilled onion and fries are pretty decent. 
And wooo the Napoli's calzone.... Yum yum. 
Open until 3am. Great to satisfy your late night hunger.
author: Mai K.

description: Fav late night pizza spot in the area, hot and delicious. Love it.
author: Bobby B.

description:
Gotta admit that I discovered this place on a drunken walk after leaving Hemlock. The first few times I ate a slice I wasn't sure if it was great because I was drunk or because it was that good.

Turns out its even better when you are sober!
author: Rachel G.

description: Wow this is the worst pizza I have eaten (or did not eat). Terrible service they are happy to mislead the delivery guy did not even come to the door (that's a first) and the food was cold.  Disappointed by the positive reviews as that's why I chose this place. I took mine back and asked for a refund, not sure I can say more.
author: Nick S.

description: Napoli Pizza is the best pizza on this block. It's great when you're drunk. Don't get too excited.
author: Alex H.

description: I absolutely love this pizza place!  It is my go-to jam after a crazy night on Polk St.  I always order the San Francisco - feta cheese, sausage, black olives, bacon.  Damn, it is one of the best pizzas I've ever eaten in my life.  I highly recommend it!
author: Alex R.

description: Not the best pizza I've ever had, but certainly not the worst either... If you're reasonably drunk this will definately hit the spot, but get there before it get swamped at 2:00am, and eat your pizza while it is still warm because by the next day, it'll probably be too hard to eat (especially the thick pepperoni slices).
author: Sam A.

description:
Trying to find a decent calzone in this town has proven to be about as difficult as finding the G-spot.  While I've been successful at the latter, I've just now fulfilled the former.

I ordered a medium calzone for delivery last night, and it came in half an hour.  When I opened the box, that beautiful crescent shaped bit of heaven was huge.  Way more than I expected for the price.  Their dough is baked to perfection and they definitely don't skimp on the cheese and toppings.  Now that I've finally found this place, they've definitely earned a spot on my speed dial.
author: Norm U.

description:
came here randomly with a friend as were patrolling Polk Street after the bars.

definitely the place to be on a Friday night...it was like another party.

the pizza was GREAT! i love pizza and to really get it great it's all about the crust for me.  i really liked the crust...it was not too thin but not too thick.  It had a little crunch to it and not soggy.  it held up nice. definitely not NY but not a pan pizza.

and the prices are VERY reasonable.

i'm definitely headin here again.
author: Daniel K.

description:
I've only eaten here once, and I was pretty drunk (having had two very strong Gin Martinis on an empty stomach) but I must say it really hit the spot. 
I'd like to hit this spot up again with a lower blood alcohol level, although apparently not after 1.
author: Katie V.

description: Not great pizza. Too much cheese and the crust is unimpressive. However, it came quickly and the delivery guy was very nice. Still looking for a solid pizzeria, this didn't really do it for me.
author: Jen M.

description:
this is my favorite pizza outside of italy, and it has nothing in common with it.  the pizza dough is perfection, the toppings are always fresh and the pizza is NEVER oily!  not a single drop of oil to be found!  i always get the vegetarian though, so i don't know if the meaty slices might have some excess oil, but still...

the best.
author: Jennifer K.

description: Its terrifying to walk through the door and the management treats the gang bangers hanging out front better than you. This place is a front. Don't go here.
author: Alice A.

description:
HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE! STAY FAR AWAY
So late on night, the boyfriend and went shopping for pizza. We found Napoli. Really excited about the pizza we ordered with a free 2 liter, we were sadly disappointed when our delivery guy did not bring the soda. So he turns around and drives to get us our soda. Minor set back, or so we think. We open the pizza to find SAUSAGE. WTF?! We don't like sausage. So in an effort to try and bear it, my boyfriend eats a slice only to find sausage chopped up everywhere. So I call the Napoli back and they tell me that it's ok they'll refund us. So When the pizza guy returns with the soda, we tell him what happens and he takes the pizza back. A second later he starts yelling at us because my boyfriend ate a slice and calls his manager. The manager proceeded to rudely tell me that he will not be refunding me for the pizza, but after a good five minutes of me telling him that this is HIS fault and a bad reflection on his pizza, he smarts up and refunds us the pizza. To add insult to injury the rude horrible delivery boy proceeds to rudely tell me to give him the pizza and the soda back. He then mumbled an insult under his breathe, to which i responded, "excuse me could you speak up when your talking to me" which he rudely answered "no habla espanol" By the way smart one, I'm Filipino.

SO...
moral of the story
AVOID AT ALL COSTS UNLESS YOU WANT TO BE DISAPPOINTED AND INSULTED
author: Angel J.

description:
Depends on when I go, regular time of the day it's probably 3 stars...

But at 3am....oh yes, definitely 5 stars.

The location is such that it's basically a crack cornerish setup, so yeah you gotta avoid some people while your waiting in line here, but I haven't encountered any negative experiences within my 2 years of going here.
author: Remi M.

description: I love there Supreme Pizza it reminds me of an old place called Monk's Pizzas in South Lake Tahoe,CA soooo good!!!
author: LJ E.

description: This is where me and my girls go at 2am after the club, drunk as sh*t and stumbling down the block.  Its delicious, cheap, and its the best thing after a night of partying. Seriously.  Minus one star for all the prostitutes and crackheads on your way from the car.
author: Renee S.

description: the pizza was good, but we were all drunk. just wanted to write a review to warn you that the delivery person doesn't take card so have cash ready.
author: Andrew A.

description: You really hungry with not a lot of cash? $4 a slice here. Couple of rough looking dudes standing in or around the area. Danger makes me hungry. Pizza usually comes out under cooked which can cause some serious IBS, and I don't mean Italy's Best Slice neither!  Other than that $4 slice. Nut up or shut up punk! It's your colon...have a little fun with it. Seriously, this place is good after a hard day's night on Polk.
author: Stafford J.

description: Excellent late night drunk food. Usually go there walking home from Hemlock. Can't really say anything bad about this place.
author: chris b.

description: I usually pick up slices from here even though there's another pizza place closer to my house. As other yelpers have pointed out, the crust on a Napoli pie is super danky. Although the wait can be a little long for a slice after the bars have closed, this is the best place for a slice on-the-run in the neighborhood. Definitely better than Irving Pizza and Picolo.
author: Mike B.

description: Dependable, greasy, cheap pizza served by some bad ass Middle Eastern guys in the middle of sleazeville. Nothing like a slice of pizza to follow an encounter with a working girl or a session in a peep show booth, eh? Clientele is either totally wasted or an active participant in the underground economy. Don't bring your prissy girlfriend.
author: Maria D.

description: Gross Pizza!!  The slices are kind of expensive, they take for ever, and when you finally get them the cheese isn't even fully melted. There's a much better place around the corner on Geary, next to Edinburgh castle.
author: Manny F.

description:
the pizza itself was pretty damn good. it was hot, but not too hot to where the bridge of your mouth is peeling for the next two days. it was crunchy, good-sized, and greasy(that's a good thing imo). and for $3, you cant really complain. 

but...i do have to complain about the wait. i have never waited 15 minutes for a slice of pepperoni, but i did last night. the place was not crowded and they had a circus of workers. how long would i have had to wait if i ordered a medium?
author: Andrew T.

description:
If you can't judge a book by it's cover, then I probably shouldn't judge a pizza place by how many trannies are hanging out by the door.  

But, I'm gonna - I mean, not really solely judge it by that alone; I just should've known.  Granted, I should've known that pizza places (surprisingly) don't make much pizza past 1am on a Tuesday night.  Whatever, I'll take a slice of cheese, if that's all you have.  Needless to say I could have probably ate a buffalo paddy I was so hungry, so sure I guess a slice of cheese will do.

I march back to the R Bar with my slice of pizza.  I notice it's the kind of pizza where the crust and the cheese seem to be two different entities, like the sauce is there as a lubricant so that the cheese and dough will actually be swallow-able (made up word?).  Anyways, before this review makes people want to touch themselves, I'll just say when I got to R Bar the doorman says "Did you go to 34's?"  I look behind me, ignore him, thinking what the?  He says it again and I realize he's actually talking to me, and apparently Napoli's got a 34 on their last inspection... so now they all just call it 34's.  He then went on to explain that lots of things unrelated (necessarily) to cleanliness can make a place get a low score, ie. no bathroom, holes in the ceiling.....  Not sure, I think it's all a bit sketchy.  I will say that I probably won't go back to this place sober, but as history has proven, probably will go back if I'm drunk and happen to stumble by.
author: Kelly H.

description: I've been on somewhat of a pizza binge lately, but this place takes the case. It's entirely no-frills, not in the greatest area of San Francisco, but the pizza is well worth it. The owner (I assume) was very friendly and the pizza came promptly as ordered. Looking forward to a return visit.
author: Steven F.

description: We are here from out of town and we wanted pizza for dinner. I hopped on here and searched for something within a few blocks of the Opal where we are staying. After perusing the reviews we chose Napoli's. Absolutely fantastic pizza. One of the reasons we chose Napoli was that they had sour dough crust. One of our favorite pizza joints is Double D's pizza in Denver. Napoli matches them. Only bad thing I can say is that they aren't all that friendly, but it fits perfectly. Gotta love it.
author: Carl S.

description: I used to think this place was really great, like I would have recommended it to people to get great pizza if you're in the Tenderloin.  However, a while back I came to realize that I had never had the slices sober.  That makes a difference!  Sober, it is not as satisfying, but it's not just because people want to eat pizza and burritos the most when they drink.  The pizza is just...well, nondescript.  Ok, I guess I could throw in a couple of descriptors, like cardboard, undercooked, etc., but that may be a little harsh.  The cheese is decent, while not wonderful, and the veggie kinda grosses me out.  The stars are for late hours, location, for the cheese pizza being all right, and for being pizza.
author: Liza W.

description: I have only tried the vegetarian pizza but I have to say it is the best pizza I've had in a long time.  The dough is amazing and just the right amount of sweet.  Also, unlike other vegetarian pizzas, when this one arrives at your door, it's not all soggy.  Muy excelente.  Come here often and leave happy.  It's a good quick bite before catching a movie at the AMC on Van Ness.  The characters that come in may be even be enough entertainment for one evening.
author: CAKE E.

description: I ordered delivery from Napoli's last night, and they make a decent pizza. The delivery guy was very friendly too which was a bonus. We ordered a mushroom pepperoni. The ingredients tasted fresh and the crust is filling. Overall, the pizza isn't exceptional, but it's a solid choice for a neighborhood pizza. I'd rather support this local pizzeria than a chain one. A minus is that the location is in a slightly bad neighborhood which is why we prefer delivery.
author: Allison v.

description: I'll always think of this as the last slice joint open, last desperate opportunity to get something soggy and warm to eat before going to bed.  I never thought much of the pizza, would never think of coming by in the daytime or ordering more than one piece, just an unnecessary evil.
author: Gil S.

description: The best pizza in the city! If u like doughy crust and a sweet sauce then this is the pizza for you.  And a slice is only $2.50.  The pizza is not greasy and you can also get topping on it if u like for a lil extra.
author: Tara S.

description: After a night of soju and karoke at Playground, and some chocolate raspberry martinis and goose&soda's at Lush Lounge, Napoli's pizza just hits the spot right before you hit the sack!  I always go for the pesto mushroom and it is just so damn good!!!  Ya all diet rules do NOT apply once it hits 2am.
author: Yoko H.

description: Maria hit this place on the nob. Perfect description.  The pizza itself is pretty good; wouldn't call it New York-style thin crust though. Its more of a San Francisco-style slice with a slightly thicker crust.  In any case, a great little option for a slab of pretty tasty bread, sauce, cheese and meat to soak up the poison after a night of fun in Polk Gulch/Tenderloin.
author: Rick H.

description: late night. last minute . drunk pizza. definitely does the job. (dont think it was amazing or anything)
author: Lisa N.

description: Notice the pattern within all these reviews....all were drunk, and you have to be in order to enjoy this shiite pizza. The caper was the crust, which tasted like a sponge that had been left out wet for a day or two. The pizza was so bad, it literally sobered me up enough to walk home safely. On that note alone, Napoli gets one star-you earned it baby!
author: Kenny G.

description:
MY FIRST 5 STAR SPOT! aight im in love with this place. the perfect combonation of heshe and piping hot pepperoni pizza. once saw a heshe crackhead get pissed off at the palestinian fools who were taking too long to cook her/his pizza. heshe was going nuts. i was sitting there on the verge of blackout and the heshe leaves with her half melted cheese pizza cuz heshe told the dudes to take it out of the oven. heshe hops straight in a cab and drives off. you never know whats gonna happen next with these heshes.

another time i just finished 2 slices of pizza, which is a lot for me. i had mad gas. i walked outside next to a group of people and let out a fart. the whole group stopped and this one dude just stared me down. i was like "what?" the group gets in their car and the dude rolls down his power window in the back of the car and continues to stare me down. i turned my back and the dude tosses his half full soda at my back! a person i was with ran down the car and they sped around some pulled over vehicles and drove off. i still love this place
author: Wats C.

description: This is the only place my friends and I were able to find that could deliver pizza to our hotel.  And this place delivered.  We ordered and they only had a 35 wait time.  Sweet!  The pizza was fine, but for the price (amazingly cheep) and the size, this pizza was all that much better.
author: Cara D.

description: Best Late night pizza by the slice.  Arnel's and Blondie's both have a good slice too.  Good cheese burger too.
author: John C.

description: mmmmm... nothing bad to say. When i get to chose this is where i will always order delivery from (free!!!) and i love nights in the area when i can stop in for a slice! they have such good topping selections and the pizza is just made right.. great crust etc.. They are open late to which is great for bar nights, can make your pizza fast whether you call it in or just stop by, and have friendly employees.
author: Barbara C.

description: Not recommended for delivery!  Get a frozen pizza and save some money.
author: michele e.

description: Granted, I am usually quite intoxicated after polk street pub crawls when I frequent this place, but it always hits the spot.  Greasy, cheesy pizza...yum.  And where else in this city can you get one slice of cheese pizza for less than 2 bucks?!  Sad, but true my friends.
author: Michelle L.

description: Perfect for when you're craving a slice of pizza while at one of the lower Polk St. bars.  Pros: It's fast, delicious and cheap. Con: Can be somewhat sketchy late at night. If you're drinking at Blur or Lush Lounge (the closest bars to Napoli), you can get your slice of pizza to go because the incredibly friendly bar staff at those two fine establishments will let you eat your pizza at the bar.
author: shoba d.

description: LOUIS B GOT THIS REVIEW ON LOCK DOWN. This place has a good selection of toppings and the foods is piping hot. i believe the official name for this place is palestinian pizza though.
author: Victor B.

description:
so the up side is that this joint delivers til 3am. the pizza isnt bad but now that i think about it i never ate their pizza when i was sober...

so the down side is that when i placed my order they asked me cash or credit so i used credit. when the delivery guy showed he got all emotional and said they dont do credit which is a load of crap because i have never paid cash to their dumb asses. so he calls his manager or someone to basicaly confirm that he is an idiot. after eating their pizza my friends and i didnt feel well after. dont get me wrong it wasnt food poisoning but maybe something they used. 
anyways ... yep most likely i will be drunk in the city @ 3am again sometime and there just isnt anyone who delivers that late ...except senores...  both places are kinda fu*ked up in there own ways so its gonna be a crap shoot...
author: Nic M.

description:
Okay, the pizza I would give 3 out of 5 but F*CK the service and attention span of this place. I wanted to go to Village Pizza a block away but they were closed so my girlfriend pointed out this place tonight. I went there and ordered 2 premium slices that came to about $10. After waiting 5 minutes or so, not long at all, I was given my box-o-pizza and I headed out. 10 minutes later when I get to my location I open of the box and find a single peperoni slice.... FOR $10 M_#*()FU(KIN DOLLARS!

I was going to hold off on writing this review and get my money back first but this places isn't worth my time. DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME HERE!
author: g m.

description: What can I say about Napoli.  It is the S**T.   Many a drunk night and hungover morning have been nursed by Napoli slices.  I think that this is possibly the best SLICE you can get in SF.  Notice I said slice.  I have ordered and still will order whole pies for delivery, even though they are not as good as the individual slices for some reason.  I have been racking my brain about why this is, and have come up with the deduction "its baked twice".  Pesto slice will make you cum in your pants.   RECOMMENDATION:  get slices, whole pies not as awesome, but still good, don't take the family here for a fun night out, the neighborhood is dodgey and there are not that many tables inside, bring a change of undies for when you release in your pants after the first bite.
author: Mark W.

description: worst pizza, and its tastes like feet. ANNND it takes forever them to make it. which sucks when your drunk, and mad people are there. Not worth the wait. Even if its customized with toppings.
author: edgar s.

description: Solid pizza and even better delivery service.  They have an average delivery time of about 25 minutes from call to delivered and I'm appr. 1.9 miles.  Hey!  That's about a 1/3 the width of SF.  Now, with pizza it seems everyone takes a firm stance on thick vs. thin crust.  Me, I like thin.  Napoli however serves up some tasty pie that's a pretty good balance between the two.  Not thin but not thick - kinda like Scarlett Johansson.  I like the Tijuana - sausage, bell pepps, onion, tomato, jalapeno.  Damn good if you like it spicy.  don't be afraid, they are only pickled jalapenos - spicy for white people.
author: J P.

description: Just as the other reviewers have observed, this is my favorite post-drinking pizza place in the Tenderloin. After having one too many at the Hemlock, nothing sounds better than a slice of pizza. And Napoli is actually really good. Last night Jessi declared it her "favorite shitty pizza in SF," and I have to say that every experience has been totally delicious. They do a good job of handling the sauce to cheese ratio and the crust is surprisingly good. And the few times I've had this pizza sober it still never disappointed.  The roaches and filthy tables contribute to the knocked off star, but it's mainly because of the anti-semitic homeless dude sitting by us last night.
author: Chloe S.

description:
Had the chance to try this pizza place during the late night with my friend while visiting in San Francisco. Usually I don't review pizza places but this one definitely deserved a good review so here I am. When you purchase the single slice order, it is quite Big! definitely bigger than I expected. The breading is great, very fresh and a nice combination of crispy and soft. Cheese was very yummy and generous, overall a great pizza to eat. I had the Greek pizza slice, my friend had the vegetarian slice...when it came to us in the box they were obviously cooked perfectly together from scratch and very very fresh!
I would not recommend trying to cut into the pizza  with the plastic fork and knife they have there though, it will not work so well due to the perfectly crisp layer of dough at the bottom of the pizza. 
So just enjoy! these guys work late into the night to make some really great pizza.
author: Mdel R.

description: It's past 2am....you're on Polk...you finished the pub crawl (or the pub crawl finished you)...you're hungry...you don't want to wait a long time for your food because if you wait too long the sandman will come. Oh yeah and you're almost broke. Liquor store snacky food ain't gonna cut it tonight you want something warm, greasy, gooey and you want it now! Get thee to Napoli. Slice of cheese pizza for $1.90!!!! Hells yeah! They have all sorts of other types for chump change more but looking for more than a couple of bucks drunk through my pockets can just reek of effort.
author: Veronica G.

description:
for Christ sakes! ....you peeps on Yelp need to take things as they are.....yeah this place is filthy...ya there are sketchy characters lurking around....yeah,  sucking a slice down you put yourself at risk of some form of food poisoning or Heppy C. ....but crap ,man, do you think Napoli pretends to be anyrthing else?...Open to at least 3 or 4am, 7 days a week, I remember coming here back in the late 80s.......was over here today and literally nothing has changed....same Palestinian co-owner, ...dude even looked the same after 20 years.......prices were even the same, $2 for a slice o chesse....the pizza is actually good...the sauce is the boss, the thickness of the crust perfect, I would go so far to say they use a decent quality cheese....and their toppings are always fresh,...every had a muchroom slice from here? ...shit is perfect here.

for all the panzies with their stuff all up in a bunch, just think about how San Franciscan this place is.....a bunch of Palestinian brothers who serve killer  , cheap, great valued pizza, on Polk street filled with hookers and trannies...they must have some killer stories to telll when they go back to the homeland
author: Garfield J.

description: I'm becoming a big fan of this place. The sauce is great and the crust is crispy. Best bang for your buck pizza joint in the hood. You just have avoid the stinkies, begging for a slice, and the hooker trannies selling their wares. But when I'm being boozed up Ro, stumbling around the TL/ Polk Gulch area, I enjoy me some Napoli.
author: Rodney V.

description: mmmm. thick, salty/doughy crust. perfect just sweet enough but not too sweet sauce. huge slice for only $2.50. this is where i pregame for my edinburgh-kokos-hemlock cycle. this delicious pizza has the added benefit of being like an alcohol absorbing sponge in my stomach, the ultimate anti-hangover remedy if you're thinking ahead - with my abysmal alcohol tolerance, i pretty much have to be. they seem to have good special slices as well, although i haven't sampled any yet.
author: Jane P.

description: When I moved to SF, I was staying at the Monarch, just around the corner from Napoli.  I found a brochure with a coupon, so I figured, what the hell.  It's pretty good pizza for cheap.  You can get the same thing only better just a couple blocks away at Picillo's.
author: CAPT i.

description: How many more reviews does this place need? No more but I must join the mass of people in saying how good the pizza is here. The Greek pizza (pesto, olives, feta) was so good I found myself craving slices of it every day that I was in town. The employees, several men who run the place, made for some friendly conversation as did some of the patrons, house-less people coming in off the street for a big slice of cheese pizza (2 bucks) paid for in change they collected outside. Standing at the counter and eating my pizza, provided me with much to observe in the way of a neighborhood pizza place and how people interact with it. Drunken wealthy spoiled brats would wander in off the street loudly and rudely. Some hard working janitors and deliverymen would come in at odd hours to get a meal and some rest. A few hipsters came in. I couldn't resist talking to them, since I have a distant loathing/masochistic fascination with that sub-culture. They were kind of intimidated and out of their element (they all betrayed southern or mid-western accents) but nonetheless complimented me on my hair and boots. I sampled their pizzas too, the San Francisco Pizza (basically the Greek but with meat on it) which was delicious and left, but not before realizing that the pizza place was providing me with more fun than all the tourist sights I had been to in San Francisco. I felt like I was in a sitcom and the pizza place was where assorted groups of characters hung out. Thank you Napoli for having awesome food and not kicking people out like the other pizza places in the area.
author: Vicente A.

description: quick, quality pizza. every pizza from here is decent. a great place to go to on a night out on polk street. expected bill: $4.
author: Tushar K.

description: Sooooo you're stumbling out of Vertigo and Blur is closed but your friends are hungry- here's a thought- walk down to Napoli's and grab the best pizza dough to soak all that EtOH...Theirs is on the doughy side- big heavy texture- luv mine with extra cheese and mushrooms...
author: Arissa C.

description: A group of us were and out and about in the area. A couple of us were starving, so we decided to check out this late night pizza joint. They were able to serve us anything in slices in literally minutes. The pizza was actually really good after a night out in the town. I would recommend it if you are out in the area and looking for some greasy food to balance the alcohol intake!
author: Vanessa W.

description: Respectable, not great... Yelpers are right, there is something unique about the crust that's actually pretty yummy.  But other than that, it was just alright.  The sauce and cheese were a little bland.... Cheap and fast though - it hit the spot.
author: A B.

description: If you like a thick and heartly hand tossed pie. I recommend Napoli's. They are not shy on the sauce and the toppings are fresh. It's a perfect order in pie and great for the price.
author: Peter N.

description: I love this place!  I love the friendly owners, I love the NOT PAPER-THIN CRUST, I love the gooey stringy cheese, I love how they pile on the toppings, I love the location.  If you like fancy organic toppings, this is not the place for you.  This is just a small pizza joint in a not-so-pretty part of town that's been here for 15 years that serves truly hearty, satisfying pizza.  I could settle into my rickety chair by the window and watch ppl parade up and down Polk St. all day.
author: Zoe L.

description: We were dying for some pizza at about 2AM and randomly picked this place out of the very few that were still open. SOOOOO GOOD!  The crust is amazing and the pizza was just damn good!  I will only order from this place in the middle of the night from now on.  I think this place just became a new craving :)  I was also freaking out for some cake but the guy laughed at me over the phone when I asked for some.  Don't judge...
author: Patrique R.

description: Its promximity to the Polk and Geary st bars is a boon to poor souls possesed by late night munchies.  The toppings bountifull, the crust overly doughy.  But that mountain of meat cheese and veggies on my slab of pizza makes it all worthwhile.  Plus these guys come through with 3 AM delivery!
author: Codester H.

description: pizza is great... however... ive ordered from them only twice and each time they charged my credit card TWICE! and i would have to call the bank and figure it out each time.. check your bank statements everyone!!!
author: Molly K.

description: The whole pizzas aren't as good as the slices.  And, the meatball sandwiches are great, but they aren't on the menu, but you can still order it.  I give this place 4 out of 5 stars.
author: James C.

description: To truly enjoy this spot you must live or have lived in the tenderloin. the stuck up mission or marina crowd will definetley take notice of the crackheads who live there and the lack of seating and the ask-if-you-want-em napkins. Tenderloiners, however, will notice the absence of floppy nasty undercooked crust. Though, mabey sometimes a bit doughy for fans of NYC style pizza (but, remeber their crust is like that because of the mineral content of the new york tap water).  I however need that crunch in my crust. Many other T.L.  pizza places make nasty, stuff with what looks like spooge for cheeze. But, this place has a consistency that can't be beat by any spot that i've been to in the entire city. VIVA NAPOLI PIZZA!!!
author: J R.

description: I was a little leery when I walked by this place, it looked pretty sketchy.  But fueled with decent reviews from Yelp, and the fact that I was starving, I decided to get a slice.  The pizza was pretty good!  I got pepperoni, and I love it when they put cheese, then pepperoni, then sprinkle some more cheese on top - yum!  For $2.50 a slice, I'd eat here again - but probably get delivery.
author: Melissa H.

description: Had to order a pizza to repay the friends that helped us move into our new place, so I hit up Yelp to find a decent place nearby that delivered.  The pizza was a bit slow to arrive, but it was mid-day on a Saturday, so to be expected.  The pizza itself was pretty good, although I thought the crust was a little dense.  All in all a good introduction to the neighborhood and we'll probably order from them again.
author: Chris P.

description: Although I have only enjoyed this place after a few beers. My sober stomach tends to be a little more critical of the toppings. You can't go wrong for the price and the slices are big enough for a good fill.
author: Jimmy S.

description: One of my favorite SF pizza spots.  Reasonable prices, yummy toppings, filling slices.
author: Colin S.

description: This is a good place to get some pizza late at night if ur drunk, even though i was drunk i did not care for it, it was too salty.. couldnt eat it all i think there are better options out there...
author: selina k.

description: Had just about the worst slice of my life here last night. I wasn't expecting much, hence the generous 2 stars, but this was real low. Must say that I knew what i was getting into, but I need to voice this right about now. To ALL pizza by the slice joints in all cities everywhere, you gotta let go of this nasty practice, of taking an old slice of cheese that is basically lifeless, throwing a bunch of toppings on it, more cheese, and then in the oven for a minute. It's just gross. I'm thankful, i suppose, that you are not wasting any food, however, it's like, for real, I'm a nice lady, and you can save the leftovers for people who are a little less nice. Like those loiterers outside that told me they would like to eat my ass, while I was crossing the street, on my way in. Also, I will give you the benefit of the doubt, and recognize that a full pizza would probably be much higher quality, but for my quick slice fix, I will stick with Piccolo Italia on Larkin and O'farrell. Or, next time, I'll dictate what is going to happen with my slice, for the customer is always right, in case you didn't know.
author: Julie H.

description: I enjoy their pizza, selection, customer service, and their late hours. However, the other night, I ordered delivery and the delivery man was very rude and aggressive. We we have lobby security and he wouldn't even bring the pizza up to room, I had to go down to the lobby to get it, which is no problem but he was very rude when I picked up the pizza. I will be back to Napoli for a late bite after the  bar but will stick to other pizzaria's in the area for day time/evening meals.
author: kevin g.

description: Found this spot after just randomly driving around lookin for a mom & pop pizza spot that was still open late. The pizza here ranks up there wit the best of them....none of the ingredients are overwhelming, its a good balance of the tomato sauce, cheese and bread crust... a good pie.
author: fern d.

description: I got a burnt pizza and they would not give me credit.  Don't even bother, there is better pizza in the city!
author: Ruth P.

description: Best pizza for delivery I've found in SF.  Lately, they have been under cooking the pizza a little, so I have the oven ready to bake it for 5 min when it arrives, and it comes out amazing.  If they didn't slightly under cook the pizza, I would give them 5 stars.
author: Chris D.

description: Definitely my go-to pizza place. Always good, good amount of cheese, and love their pepporoni and sausage. And inexpensive and quick!
author: Brian O.

description: shady?  sure.  especially at the time of night(/morning?) i'm prone to hustling in here for a slice of my mega-super-monster pizza.  ok, it sounds weird, but TRY IT and let heaven waltz on your tongue:  Pesto, Pineapple, Jalapeno.  yeah, yeah... but if you TRY IT... you'll LOVE IT.  any place that can make me get away with a slice of my own whim, and in the wee hours of the morn.......... gets my respect.  thanks, napoli!
author: Beccie F.

description: I chose to eat here because it was close and it delivered.  I ordered my food through delivery.com and it arrived in around 30 minutes.  Woohoo.  As for the food, it was pretty tasty for the most part.  I ordered a small pepperoni and pineapple pizza and a Hawaiian salad.  Portions are huge!  The salad alone could have been a meal, and I'll be eating that pizza for days to come.  The food itself was just ok.  I personally did not like the crust at all.  It was really chewy in the center and kind of burned along the edges.  The toppings were alright, the pepperoni was somewhat burned as well.  It still tasted pretty good, but I've had much better.  They were attentive to my special request or extra pineapple and several ranches on the side, however.  So overall, quick and inexpensive food that is pretty good, but nothing special, but comes in generous portions.  This place would be great if it was 2 am and I was stumbling around looking for a quick bite to soak the Tequila up in my stomach!  ha....
author: Bryan P.
